column12: Heat dissipation performance early warning method and system based on big data, excavator and engineering machinery
column13: The invention discloses a heat dissipation performance early warning method and system based on big data, an excavator and engineering machinery, and the method comprises the steps: collecting the working condition data of the excavator under the actual working condition, obtaining the extreme environment temperature which can be adapted by the excavator at the current moment based on a pre-fitted heat dissipation performance analysis model, and calculating the working condition data of the excavator; and comparing with a preset value so as to evaluate the heat dissipation performance. According to the method, the heat dissipation performance degradation trend can be predicted according to the change trend of the heat dissipation performance along with the use time of the excavator, a user is reminded of timely maintenance, and a basis is provided for subsequent heat dissipation performance design.
column15: BIAN JINLONG;;HUANG YONG;;SONG FANGZHEN;;XU WEI;;WEI JING;;LI XUECHENG;;ZHAO SHUANG

column12: LEARNABLE DEFECT DETECTION FOR SEMICONDUCTOR APPLICATIONS
column13: Methods and systems for learnable defect detection for semiconductor applications are provided. One system includes a deep metric learning defect detection model configured for projecting a test image for a specimen and a corresponding reference image into latent space, determining a distance in the latent space between one or more different portions of the test image and corresponding portion(s) of the corresponding reference image, and detecting defects in the one or more different portions of the test image based on the determined distances. Another system includes a learnable low-rank reference image generator configured for removing noise from one or more test images for a specimen thereby generating one or more reference images corresponding to the one or more test images.

column12: NETWORKED GAMES, RIDES AND ATTRACTIONS
column13: Various types of entertainment venues, including theme or amusement parks, game arcades, and similar venues are improved by providing a local server exchanging data with a cloud server. The local server controls and communicates with game or entertainment elements at the venue. The game or entertainment elements may be games at the location, input devices used by participants, such as smart phones, and/or audio and video devices. The cloud server controls and communicates with off-site elements. The cloud server and local server may communicate and synchronize data over the internet. The entertainment venue consequently can provide varying and evolving experiences through gamification.
column15: MAGPURI CECIL D;;WALLACE MICHAEL JOHN;;SCHAEFER DAVID MICHAEL;;ALI SYED SAHAM;;CONSOLO DAVID JAMES
column16: FALCON'S BEYOND BRANDS LLC (2023-06-27);;FALCON'S TREEHOUSE LLC (2020-06-17);;FALCON'S CREATIVE GROUP LLC (2023-06-27);;FALCON'S BEYOND GLOBAL LLC (2023-06-27)

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR PATIENT ENGAGEMENT
column13: Embodiments herein provide a method for a patient to increase engagement with cognitive behavioral therapy by a system (100), which in turn will increase the efficacy of the therapy. The embodiment is meant to be used in a clinical setting, specifically in an outpatient group program with a supervising therapist that meets weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly. The embodiment uses machine learning (ML), a group component, and gamification to promote increased engagement. ML (natural language processing) is used to help the patient automatically classify his/her negative thoughts into a pre-set taxonomy of ‘cognitive distortions’ or retrieve a previously stored triple column entry. The group component allows for the patient to request help from his/her groupmates in between in-person meetings. Gamification provides an additional incent to participate in the therapy: Within groups, teams of three patients compete against each other by scoring points proportional to their engagement with the app.

column12: SYSTEMS FOR A PERSONALIZED UNIFORM RESOURCE LOCATOR ENCODED FOR FULL CHAIN-OF-ATTRIBUTION
column13: Systems for a personalized Uniform Resource Locator (URL) encoded for full chain-of-attribution enabling exponential growth marketing are disclosed. Some embodiments may include: generating a personalized Uniform Resource Locator (URL) for a creator, the personalized URL being encoded for full chain-of-attribution by being specific for the creator, the personalized URL comprising a protocol, an Internet Protocol address, and a sub-directory, the sub-directory being specific for the creator, providing the personalized URL to the creator for sharing with a plurality of followers of the creator, receiving registration data of click inputs by the plurality of followers on the personalized URL, generating a destination Uniform Resource Locator based on the click inputs by the plurality of followers on the personalized URL, the destination URL being encoded for the full chain-of-attribution by being specific for the creator and specific for a destination.

column12: Converting text-based goals to gamification system
column13: Systems, methods, and computer program products to perform an operation comprising receiving a text object comprising a plurality of text statements, inputting the text object into a text analyzer executing on a processor, the text analyzer configured to analyze the plurality of text statements in the text object based at least in part on a structure of the plurality of statements in the text object, classifying a first statement of the plurality of statements as including at least one of a performance index and an action, defining, based on the analyzing and classifying, a mission comprising the first statement as the at least one of the performance index and the action, and deploying, in a gamification system, the mission and a plurality of backend computing resources for the mission.

column12: DESIGN AWARE ADAPTIVE MIXED-SIGNAL SIMULATION
column13: A computing system implementing a design verification system can classify a mixed-signal circuit design describing an electronic device based on a design topology of the mixed-signal circuit design. This classification can be performed by identifying a top-level design block in the mixed-signal circuit design, traversing a connectivity of a design hierarchy to identify lower-level design blocks in the mixed-signal circuit design, and classifying the mixed-signal circuit design based on at least one of a design type of the top-level design block, design types of the lower-level design blocks, or a connectivity of design blocks in the mixed-signal circuit design. The design verification system can selectively partition the mixed-signal circuit design into an analog partition and a digital partition based on the classification, and simulate the analog partition of the mixed-signal circuit design with an analog simulator and the digital partition of the mixed-signal circuit design with a digital simulator.

column12: Dynamic modifications of single player and multiplayer mode in a video game
column13: A video game includes a single player mode where completion of storyline objectives advances the single player storyline. The video game also includes a multiplayer mode where a plurality of players can play on an instance of a multiplayer map. Storyline objectives from the single player mode are selected and made available for completion to players in the multiplayer mode, and the single player storylines can be advanced by players completing respective storyline objectives while playing in the multiplayer mode. Combinations of storyline objectives are selected from pending storyline objectives for players connecting to a multiplayer game for compatibility with multiplayer maps. Constraints can be used to determine compatibility.
column15: CHAPUT HAROLD HENRY;;HARDER JESSE HANS STOKES;;KADING DANIEL LEE;;EPLER JOHN CHRISTOPHER;;KOLEN JOHN;;AGHDAIE NAVID;;ZAMAN KAZI ATIF-UZ;;MOSS KENNETH ALAN;;PERLINSKI THOMAS MURRAY;;SCOTT GRAHAM FRANCIS

column12: SYSTEM FOR IMPROVING NEUROSTIMULATION TREATMENT COMPLIANCE WITH GAMIFICATION
column13: Gamification for a pelvic disorder regimen has a processor for operating a control module configured to define a programmable treatment regimen. A neurostimulator is connected to the processor and the control module. The neurostimulator applies electrical or magnetic signals to the user according to the programmable treatment regimen which includes at least one treatment task to be performed by the user. A gramification module calculates and stores a set of scores of the user in performing at least one task defined in the programmable treatment program associated with one or more events defined in the programmable treatment program to provide a score assigned to each task performance. A user interface is connected to the control module and provides the user with information associated with the scores attained by the user.

column12: Groupware System for Providing Education Information to Teacher and Student
column13: A groupware system for providing educational information to a teacher and a student notifies a class schedule of a different teacher when a teacher sets a class schedule and allows the teacher to plan an academic schedule through consultation with the different teacher. The present invention has an effect capable of sharing a school work and processing it in real time through a smart app. The present invention can plan the academic schedule through consultation with other teachers The present invention can plan an academic schedule through consultation with a different teacher to avoid unnecessary duplication of registration and automatically calculate various academic schedules such as student-specific and class-specific experiential learning and the like and notify them, thereby having an effect of maximizing work efficiency.

column12: Integrated Circuit Layout Validation Using Machine Learning
column13: Systems, methods, and devices are described herein for integrated circuit (IC) layout validation. A plurality of IC patterns are collected which include a first set of patterns capable of being manufactured and a second set of patterns incapable of being manufactured. A machine learning model is trained using the plurality of IC patterns. The machine learning model generates a prediction model for validating IC layouts. The prediction model receives data including a set of test patterns comprising scanning electron microscope (SEM) images of IC patterns. Design violations associated with an IC layout are determined based on the SEM images and the plurality of IC patterns. A summary of the design violations is provided for further characterization of the IC layout.
column15: SALIK RACHID;;HSU CHIN-CHANG;;WU CHENG-CHI;;CHEN CHIEN-WEN;;YANG WEN-JU

column12: Information Technology Ecosystem Environment for Performing an Information Technology Sustainability Empowerment Operation
column13: A system, method, and computer-readable medium for performing an information technology (IT) ecosystem management and monitoring operation. The IT ecosystem management and monitoring operation includes providing a sustainability application to an information handling system; obtaining sustainability information regarding the information handling system via the sustainability application; providing an IT ecosystem monitoring and management console, the IT ecosystem monitoring and management console comprising an IT ecosystem sustainability system, the IT ecosystem sustainability system comprising a sustainability component; and, communicating between the sustainability component and the sustainability application to perform an IT sustainability empowerment operation, the communicating providing the sustainability component with the sustainability information regarding the information handling system.

column12: TIRE VULCANIZATION FAILURE OCCURRENCE PREDICTION METHOD AND TIRE MANUFACTURING METHOD
column13: To provide a vulcanization failure occurrence prediction method capable of easily and highly accurately predicting the possibility of a vulcanization failure occurrence by using design specification data of a green tire and sectional shape data of a molded surface of a used mold, and a tire manufacturing method using this prediction method.SOLUTION: A vulcanization failure occurrence prediction method stores, in an arithmetic unit 2, a prediction model PM generated by machine-learning design specification data D1 including a sectional shape of a green tire G, sectional shape data D2 of a molded surface 7, and vulcanization failure occurrence data D3 in a tire T obtained by vulcanizing a green tire G molded on the basis of multiple different design specification data D1 by a mold 6 as teacher data, and predicts the occurrence presence of a vulcanization failure in a target tire Ta obtained by vulcanizing the green tire Ga by the mold 6 by assigning the design specification data D1 of the green tire Ga to be predicted and the sectional shape data D2 of a molded surface 7 to the prediction model PM to execute an arithmetic operation.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: Personality-type training system and methods
column13: A personality-type training gamification system that includes a communications link configured to receive one or more communications, an analysis processor in bi-directional communication with the communications link with a plurality of non-transitory computer readable instructions stored in association therewith that are accessible to, and executable by, the processor, wherein the plurality of instructions, when executed receive the one or more communications from the communications link, analyze the one or more communications to identify personality types associated with the one or more communications, provide an overview of each identified personality type to a user; and provide one or more games or quizzes to the user and instructions to take the one or more games or quizzes to test the user's knowledge of the plurality of personality types provided; and a display device configured to display to the user at least a performance analysis for the user.

column12: PREDICTION METHOD FOR CROSS SECTIONAL SHAPE OF TIRE AND MANUFACTURING METHOD FOR TIRE
column13: To provide a prediction method that can more accurately predict a cross sectional shape of a tire that is manufactured by vulcanizing a green tire, using design specification data of the green tire and cross sectional shape data of a molding surface of a mold to be used, and a manufacturing method for a tire utilizing the prediction method.SOLUTION: A prediction model PM, which is created by subjecting design specification data D1 including cross section shapes of green tires G, cross sectional shape data D2 on a molding surface 7 of a mold 6 and cross section image data D3 on a tire T manufactured by vulcanizing a number of green tires G whose design specification data D1 are different using the mold 6, as teaching data, to machine learning, is stored in a calculation device 2; and the design specification data D1 on green tires Ga to be predicted and the cross sectional shape data D2 on the molding surface 7 are substituted in the prediction model PM and are subjected to calculation processing, so as to predict a cross sectional shape of a target tire Ta that is manufactured by vulcanizing the green tires Ga using the mold 6.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR DIGITAL DOCUMENT TOOLS
column13: This disclosure relates to computer implemented systems and methods for designing digital documents. The system including a set of instructions to cause at least one processor device and related data processing apparatus to operate to provide a resource module that enables extraction of individual elements of digital resources and storage of the extracted individual elements for use in a design layout, a layout module that enables creation of the design layout in a user-customizable manner using design blocks, an assignment module that enables assignment of the individual elements to the design blocks to create a design layout, and a document creation module that enables the exportation of the design layout to a selectable file format or a selectable medium.

column12: Method for apply gamification techniques to a security system
column13: The present disclosure relates to a computer implemented method for apply gamification techniques to a security system, allowing scoring of users handling events generated within the security system. The present disclosure also relates to a corresponding security system and a computer program product.

column12: Augmented reality based gamification for location-based man-machine interactions
column13: When a user moves into a geographical region around a location, a notification is sent to the user computing device regarding gameplay and an associated incentive related to a merchant location. The user enters the merchant location and a game server generates augmented reality (AR) data for the computing device to use in playing a game at the merchant location. The camera of the computing device captures interior views of the merchant location and a game instance on the computing device uses those images in generation of an AR game at the user computing device related to the merchant. Upon successful completion of the game play, the user receives an incentive or award. The merchant may use an application program interface (API) hosted by the game server to allow specifying game conditions and related awards.
column32: Adhani et al. A survey of Mobile Augmented Reality Applications. 2012 1st International Conference on Future Trends in Computing and Communication Technologies, pp. 89-95. (Year: 2012).

column12: ADVANCED MATERIAL HANDLING VEHICLE
column13: An advanced material handling vehicle is provided. Specifically, the advanced material handling vehicle can include one or more sensors coupled to a body of the material handling vehicle and electrically coupled to a processor. The processor executes instructions related to a perception system that monitors a location of the advanced material handling vehicle and controls one or more tasks and functions of the material handling vehicle based on sensor data.

column12: Content delivery
column13: A content delivery method, system, and non-transitory computer readable medium, include determining an attentiveness factor in response to viewing of a media content and replaying the media content starting from a point that the attentiveness factor is determined to be less than a predetermined threshold.

column12: Integrated working method and system for energetic material comprehensive performance design simulation tool
column13: The invention provides an integrated working method and system for an energetic material comprehensive performance design simulation tool, and the system comprises a file management module which is used for managing different types of design simulation tool models and data; the data interface module is used for carrying out data definition on a design simulation tool model and data, and defining the tool model and the data into a shaping type, a character type, a Boolean type, a readable file type and an analysis file type by virtue of a standardized parameter form; the data analysis module is used for analyzing the model and the data through a data interface; the tool integration module is used for uniformly storing and calling design simulation tools according to a standardized form; and the parameter management module is used for performing unified management on the analyzed parameters.
column14: BEIJING RES INST MECHANICAL & ELECTRICAL TECH

column12: IMAGE PROCESSING SYSTEM AND COMPUTER PROGRAM FOR PERFORMING IMAGE PROCESSING
column13: An object of the present invention is to achieve both suppression of data amount of an image processing system that learns a collation image to be used for image identification using a discriminator and improvement of identification performance of the discriminator. In order to achieve the above object, there is proposed an image processing system including a discriminator that identifies an image using a collation image, the image processing system further including a machine learning engine that performs machine learning of collation image data required for image identification. The machine learning engine searches for a successfully identified image using an image for which identification has been failed, and adds information, obtained based on a partial image of the image for which identification has been failed and which has been selected by an input device to the successfully identified image obtained by the search to generate corrected collation image data.

column12: RISK ASSESSMENT FOR SUICIDE AND TREATMENT BASED ON INTERACTION WITH VIRTUAL CLINICIAN, FOOD INTAKE TRACKING, AND/OR SATIETY DETERMINATION
column13: Novel tools and techniques are provided for implementing medical or medical-related diagnosis and treatment, and, more particularly, for implementing risk assessment for suicide and treatment based on interaction with virtual clinician, food intake tracking, and/or satiety determination. In various embodiments, a computing system might generate a virtual clinician capable of simulating facial expressions and body expressions, and might cause, using a display device and/or an audio output device, the generated virtual clinician to interact with a patient. The computing system might analyze the interactions between the virtual clinician and the patient (and in some cases, food intake data) to determine likelihood of risk of suicide by the patient, and, based on a determination that a likelihood of risk of suicide by the patient exceeds a first predetermined threshold value, might send an alert message to one or more healthcare professionals regarding the likelihood of risk of suicide by the patient.

column12: Student digital literacy behavior data acquisition method and device based on xAPI specification, and storage medium
column13: The invention discloses a student digital literacy behavior data acquisition method based on an xAPI specification, and the method is applied to a student digital literacy gamification evaluation test, and comprises the steps: obtaining the identity information of a tested person; obtaining evaluation demand information; according to the evaluation demand information, selecting a game scene from preset game scenes to form a gamification evaluation test; performing gamification evaluation test by the tested person to obtain test information; the identity information and the test information form a declaration statement, and the declaration statement is sent to a learning recording system terminal; obtaining a characteristic variable according to the declaration statement; and constructing a mapping relationship between the characteristic variables and the specific numerical value of the evaluation demand information. According to the invention, different gamification evaluation test contents can be generated according to different evaluation requirements, so that evaluation for digital literacy of students can be customized.
column15: ZHU SHA;;WU DI;;LI JIAYUAN;;BAI JIE;;GUO QING

column12: Methods, systems, and computer readable media for automated behavioral assessment
column13: The subject matter described herein includes methods, systems, and computer readable media for automated behavioral assessment. According to one aspect, a method for automated behavioral assessment is provided. The method occurs at a computing platform including a processor and memory. The method includes providing at least one stimulus for eliciting a response from a user. The method also includes obtaining, using a camera or sensor communicatively coupled to the computing platform, the at least one response. The method also includes determining, using the at least one response, a behavioral assessment associated with the user.

column12: ABSTRACTED INTERFACE FOR GAMIFICATION OF MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHMS
System for the automated, context sensitive, and non-intrusive insertion of consumer-adaptive content in video
column13: Described herein is a method and system for automated, context sensitive and non-intrusive insertion of consumer-adaptive content in video. It assesses ‘context’ in the video that a consumer is viewing through multiple modalities and metadata about the video. The method and system described herein analyzes relevance for a consumer based on multiple factors such as the profile information of the end-user, history of the content, social media and consumer interests and professional or educational background, through patterns from multiple sources. The system also implements local-context through search techniques for localizing sufficiently large, homogenous regions in the image that do not obfuscate protagonists or objects in focus but are viable candidate regions for insertion for the intended content. This makes relevant, curated content available to a user in the most effortless manner without hampering the viewing experience of the main video.
column15: SRINIVASA GOWRI;;AJOY ATMIK;;GOWRISH DHANYA;;MAHINDRAKAR CHETHAN U

column12: EVENT GAMIFICATION IN REAL TIME
column13: A consumer may enroll in an event gamification system. An event listener may detect an event. The event gamification system may determine that the event qualifies for a game in which the consumer is enrolled. The event gamification system may transmit an achievement notification to the consumer as soon as the event occurs. The game may be displayed in a GUI on a consumer device. The consumer may be rewarded for completing the achievements in the game. Also, a server computer receiving a plurality of data sets that represent visually perceptible elements for a plurality of host web pages, wherein each of the plurality of host web pages displays an active link associated with a product on a merchant web page. The server automatically generating composite web page from: i) the particular data set associated with the particular host web page and the particular set of visually perceptible elements and ii) the related electronic content associated with the product from the merchant web page.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR REAL-TIME PARTICIPATORY DATA COLLECTION
column13: The present invention provides a method and system for real-time data collection using smart phones and external sensor devices comprising: capturing an image using a mobile device; connecting and interacting to a plurality of external sensor devices through the mobile device; collecting internal sensor data from the mobile device; collecting external sensor data from the plurality of external sensor devices; embedding the collected internal sensor data and external sensor data in the image header of the captured image; blending the embedded sensor data with the captured image in accordance with one or more predefined templates for image layout enhancement; uploading the captured image to a computer application; cataloging a plurality of uploaded images; and enabling users to manage and interact with the plurality of uploaded images.

column12: System and method for selective vehicle data retrieval
column13: A system for providing mobile application-based vehicle diagnostics includes a mobile communication device (“device”) having an installed mobile application (“app”). The app receives an instruction to obtain vehicle condition information of a vehicle, determines a geolocation of the device, and displays a geolocation of a diagnostic service provider on the device. A diagnostic tool operable by the diagnostic service provider retrieves diagnostic data from the vehicle. A server operable by a different entity than the diagnostic service provider establishes a user profile associated with a user of the device and including a vehicle identification number (VIN) of the vehicle, receives the diagnostic data from the diagnostic tool, detects the VIN in the diagnostic data, derives vehicle condition information from the diagnostic data, associates the vehicle condition information with the user profile by matching the VIN, and provides the vehicle condition information to the app to be displayed on the device.

column12: GAMIFIED VIRTUAL CONFERENCE WITH NETWORK SECURITY TRAINING OF NETWORK SECURITY PRODUCTS
column13: Systems and methods for demonstrating network security products in a virtual conference and providing training to attendees of a network security training session in the virtual conference through the use of gamification are provided. A server generates a dedicated virtual environment for a particular attendee. A three-dimensional (3D) user interface for the virtual conference is presented on a display of the particular attendee, which represents a simulated conference environment with each network security product being demonstrated as a virtual booth represented in the conference environment. A game client causes the particular attendee to navigate in the 3D user interface to a first virtual booth to access a first learning objective relating to demonstration of a first network security product corresponding to the first booth. A progress report, which is maintained by the server, is used to notify regarding other learning objectives that are of potential interest to the particular attendee.
column15: MAY ROBERT A;;THOMPSON JORDAN E;;PATE JAMIE

column12: Detecting gamified challenge by non-human user
column13: When a user suspected of communicating with a website is a robot, a gamification challenge is presented to the user. The gamified challenge includes a dynamic sequence of sequentially displayed animated set objects with which the user should interact within the allocated amount of time. The complexity of a gamification challenge is increased when the challenge fails and when features extracted from a user session indicate that a suspected gamification challenge is a high level of suspicion performed by a non-human user.
column15: LARSON TIMOTHY C;;CASTRO DAVID E;;PICKERING ANDREW RICHARD;;WANG JUN

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR PROVIDING A TECHNOLOGY-SUPPORTED-TRUSTED-PERFORMANCE FEEDBACK AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING SYSTEM
column13: A system for providing trusted performance feedback and experiential learning is disclosed. The system may include receiving, from a first user, feedback related to the effectiveness of a second user relating to participation by the second user in an event. The system may assign the information to avatars of the first and second users. To ensure a user's information remains private to that user, the avatars may be anonymized virtual representations of the first and second users within a virtual social network. Based on an analysis of the information, the system may generate condition state data for the avatars for the first and second users respectively. The condition state data may be time series variables that represent a relationship of the avatars. Based on the condition state data, the system may provide a recommendation or report to the second user for improving the second user's effectiveness at a future event.

column12: SYSTEM WITH AI FOR TRAINING AND CHECKING THE HEALTH STATUS OF A PERSON
column13: A monitoring and training system (1) is described, comprising: a biometric device (3) designed to collect data from at least one user; an AI software (5) comprising a plurality of machine learning algorithms designed to process the data provided by the biometric device (3); an application (11) for smartphones operationally connected to the biometric device (3) and to the AI software (5), the application (11) being designed to provide the user with data processed in real time.

column12: CROWD-SOURCED DATA COLLECTION AND LABELLING USING GAMING MECHANICS FOR MACHINE LEARNING MODEL TRAINING
column13: A computer-implemented method of data collection and labeling, the method comprising: receiving, at a server in a cloud environment, a photo of a food item from an augmented reality environment in a gamified application executing on a user device (1201); in response to receiving the photo, generating, by a machine learning model executing in the cloud environment, classification information for the food item represented by the photo (1203); sending the classification information to the user device for display in the augmented reality environment thereon (1205); receiving, from the user device, verified information, wherein the verified information includes an indication for associating the photo with a virtual character in the augmented reality environment, wherein the indication is generated by the gamified application in response to the virtual character being fed with the photo in the augmented reality environment (1207); and storing the photo and the verified information into a data store in the cloud environment (1209).

column12: Predicting performance system and method using designable artificial intelligence model based on domain knowledge
column13: The present invention relates to a performance prediction system using an artificial intelligence model that can be designed based on a domain knowledge. More specifically, when developing a new product but is similar to a previously developed product, the present invention relates to the system that can improve a performance improvement of a new development target product and perform a derivation of a new design plan using, in a product development step, the virtual performance data using the existing performance data without a design and analysis process of a CAE model; and the method therefor. The performance prediction system comprises: a preprocessing learning part; and a main processing learning part.

column12: Psychological behavior feedback system and method based on sensory characteristics of young people
column13: The invention relates to a psychological behavior feedback system and method based on sensory characteristics of young people. The system comprises a gamification interaction packet module which is a series of game sets and is also used for collecting the personal basic information of an evaluator authorized by a user; a data collection module used for collecting basic reaction indexes of the user in the game process; a data real-time transmission module used for storing the basic data collected by the gamification interaction packet module to a database in real time for analysis; a data analysis and comparison module used for analyzing the basic data transmitted in real time; a psychological behavior result feedback module used for extracting data of the data analysis and comparison module; a personalized training module which provides targeted training and promotion schemes for the user, wherein the training and promotion schemes comprise a high-intensity promotion training scheme, a low-intensity promotion training scheme and an ability maintenance training scheme, and provides training result feedback, draws a user growth curve and forms a closed loop after each training of the user.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD OF IDENTIFYING AND UTILIZING AGENT EFFECTIVENESS IN HANDLING MULTIPLE CONCURRENT MULTI-CHANNEL INTERACTIONS
column13: A computerized-method for identifying and utilizing effectiveness of agent handling multiple concurrent multi-channel interactions is provided herein. The computerized-method includes operating of a Multiple Multi-Channel Effectiveness (MME) module. The MME module includes: (a) operating an interaction module to retrieve one or more concurrent interactions of an agent from the data storage of interactions, according to a time range; (b) calculating an MME score for the agent based on metadata of the one or more concurrent interactions which defines the ability of the agent to handle multiple concurrent multi-channel interactions simultaneously; (c) storing the calculated MME score in the data storage of agents; and (d) sending the MME score to the one or more applications to take one or more follow-up actions based on the MME score.

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR COMPUTERIZED INTERACTIVE SKILL TRAINING
column13: The present invention is directed to interactive training, and in particular, to methods and systems for computerized interactive skill training. An example embodiment provides a method and system for providing skill training using a computerized system. The computerized system receives a selection of a first training subject. Several related training components can be invoked, such as reading, watching, performing, and/or reviewing components. In addition, a scored challenge session is provided, wherein a training challenge is provided to a user via a terminal, optionally in video form.

column12: Rehabilitation training equipment for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and use method thereof
column13: The invention relates to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease rehabilitation training equipment and a using method thereof.The chronic obstructive pulmonary disease rehabilitation training equipment comprises control equipment and display equipment, the control equipment is provided with a plurality of air blowing pipes which are sequentially arranged from long to short, and after air is blown into the air blowing pipes, the air blowing pipes make sounds with corresponding pitches according to the length of an air column; the head end of the air blowing pipe is provided with a microphone for sensing an air blowing signal and a circuit control module electrically connected with the microphone; the display device is in wireless connection with the circuit control module of the control device through the Internet of Things. The display device is used for displaying a simulation picture of the control device, the simulation picture comprises strip-shaped areas corresponding to different air blowpipes, and the display device is further used for displaying music symbols appearing in the different strip-shaped areas. According to the breathing rehabilitation training equipment, traditional functional rehabilitation training experience is improved through gamification optimization, music elements are introduced, different sounds are made along with the training rhythm, the interestingness of rehabilitation training can be enhanced, a patient can more participate in training, and the initiative of a user is motivated.

column12: METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING CUSTOM-MADE ANTI-SEISMIC PORTALS AND ANTI-SEISMIC PORTAL THUS OBTAINED
column13: Anti-seismic, armoured, custom-made portal (10) comprising: - aluminium and/or wood internal panel (11); - aluminium and/or wood external panel (13); - polyurethane foam (12) suitably mixed and/or reinforced with reinforcement elements to achieve the desired thermal, acoustic and safety performance; - preparation for a home automation system; - a pre-set collapse area (18), arranged above the upper framework (16) of said portal (10), dimensioned as a function of the geometry of the portal (10) and being suitable to yield structurally, in a controlled and pre-set manner, in case of seismic events or structural collapse of the building, guaranteeing the possibility of opening said portal (10) by making it rotate around its hinges.

column12: ORGANIZATION SYSTEM, ORGANIZATION PROCESS, LEARNING SYSTEM, MEMORIZATION PROCESS, CONCEPT INCORPORATION SYSTEM, CONCEPT INCORPORATION PROCESS, AND METHODS OF USE FOR UNDERSTANDING GENERAL KNOWLEDGE OF IMPORTANT AND DIFFICULT INFORMATION
column13: An organization system, organization process, learning system, memorization process, concept incorporation system, concept incorporation process, processes, and method of use are presented. More specifically and without limitation, this disclosure relates to a durable and beautiful program and system that will make a user knowledgeable and organized. More specifically and without limitation, this disclosure relates to training medical practitioners such as nurses in the field of nursing. More specifically and without limitation, this disclosure relates to training nursing professionals. More specifically, and without limitation, this disclosure relates to life planning. More specifically, and without limitation, this disclosure relates to providing activities, questions, reference guides, and other activities in a system which provides a unique and systematic manner of remembering difficult concepts and information.

column12: BRAINWAVE ENTRAINMENT USING VIRTUAL OBJECTS AND GAMIFICATION
column13: A system and method for brainwave entrainment using virtual objects and gamification, in which brainwave entrainment is applied using some combination of gaming elements, brainwave is enhanced by virtue of the user's active participation, and long-term use is encouraged by virtue of the entertaining nature of the gamification. Depending on configuration, the system and method may comprise a. display comprising virtual objects, a light-producing device (other than the display), an audio-producing device such as speakers or headphones, a haptic feedback device such as a vibratory motor, a means for monitoring the user's attention, and. a software application which applies brainwave entrainment using some combination of the display, the light-producing device, the audio-producing device, and the haptic feedback device.

column12: INTEGRATED EQUIPMENT FAULT AND CYBER ATTACK DETECTION ARRANGEMENT
column13: An integrated vehicle health management (IVHM) system to resolve equipment-fault related anomalies detected by cyber intrusion detection system (IDS). A benefit of the present system is that it can result in fewer alerts that need manual analysis. A combination of cyber and monitoring with integrated vehicle health management (IVHM) may be a high value differentiator. As a solution gets more mature through a learning loop, it may be customized for different customers in a cost effective manner, something that might be expensive to develop on their own for most original equipment manufacturers (OEMs). An IVHM symptom pattern recognition matrix may link a pattern of reported symptoms (e.g., anomalies) to known equipment failures (electrical connections, sensors, controllers, known cyber-attacks, and so on). This matrix may be initialized from the vehicle design data but its entries may get updated by a learning loop that improves a correlation by incorporating results of investigations.

column12: Exercise intensity-driven level design
column13: Balancing an exercise intensity level and a fun factor of a game is non-trivial and challenging. Disclosed herein are aspects and embodiments of an optimization-based approach to address this challenge. The approach can be applied to synthesize a game level with a desired exercise intensity level. By formulating the design problem as an optimization, a level designer can easily balance factors concerning the exercise intensity level of the game as well as other design factors and constraints.

column12: Multi-dimensional assessment method and system for cardiovascular cognitive impairment
column13: The invention discloses a multi-dimensional assessment method and system for cardiovascular cognitive impairment. The method comprises the following steps: acquiring a specific task framework for people with cardiovascular cognitive impairment; wherein the specific task framework comprises a plurality of cognitive domains, and each cognitive domain corresponds to at least one gamification evaluation task; on the basis of a specific task framework, any cognitive domain is selected, and any gamification evaluation task is obtained, so that the cardiovascular cognitive impairment crowd and the normal crowd complete the task respectively; acquiring first task data and first physiological data of people with cardiovascular cognitive impairment, and performing fusion analysis to obtain a first norm score; acquiring second task data and second physiological data of the normal crowd, and performing fusion analysis to obtain a second norm score; comparing the first norm score with the second norm score to output a cognitive evaluation result; and repeating the process until the cognitive impairment assessment of the crowd with cardiovascular cognitive impairment is completed.
column14: BEIJING ANZHEN HOSPITAL AFFILIATED TO CAPITAL MEDICAL UNIV

column12: DISTRIBUTED ENERGY RESOURCE SYSTEM DESIGN AND OPERATION
column13: An energy management system for enhancing design and operation of a distributed energy resource system includes a two-level design system and a hierarchical optimization-based control system. The two-level design system includes a top-level designer configured to coordinate decentralized bottom-level designers for individual energy resources to seek a global target for the designed distributed energy resource system that satisfies the energy demand of a target deployment location within a confidence level, and multiple bottom-level designers configured to enhance detailed designs of local energy sub-systems. The hierarchical optimization-based control system include a primary controller configured to determine a long-term operational schedule based on long-term constraints and future events at a first level, one or more secondary controllers configured to control daily orchestrations of the distributed energy resource system during operation at a second level, and multiple tertiary controllers and aggregators configured to rapidly adjust various hardware at a third level.

column12: Textile and garment production design template card storage equipment based on big data
column13: The invention discloses textile and garment production design template card storage equipment based on big data. The textile and garment production design template card storage equipment comprises a first box body, a storage mechanism, a classification prompting mechanism, a fixing mechanism and a deinsectization mechanism. When the textile and garment production design template card storage equipment is used, design template cards are placed in an L-shaped shell and slide into the first box body, and are inserted into inserting grooves through inserting blocks, so that the L-shaped shell is fixed, a user counts hot data corresponding to a display label by utilizing the big data, the data is transmitted into a storage module by utilizing a wireless receiving and transmitting module, and a display screen reads the data in the storage module, so that the display screen can display the storage label of the template cards and the big data corresponding to the label at the same time; and meanwhile, according to the scheme, a pesticide or a cleaning agent in a water tank is pumped through a water pump, and spraying operation is carried out on the interior of the first box body through a first pipe body and an atomizing nozzle, so that pests in the first box body can be effectively removed or a cleaning effect is achieved.
column32: 姜文学: "《家兔养殖专家答疑》", 30 September 2013, pages: 121

column12: GAMIFIED NETWORK SECURITY TRAINING USING DEDICATED VIRTUAL ENVIRONMENTS SIMULATING A DEPLOYED NETWORK TOPOLOGY OF NETWORK SECURITY PRODUCTS
column13: Systems and methods are described for providing training to attendees of a network security training session through use of gamification. A virtual environment is created containing a network topology simulating a deployed network of network security devices for which teams of the attendees are to receive training. A 3D game interface is presented on a display of a computer system of an attendee. Based on a leaderboard server's game state, a problem-solving objective for the training session is presented on the display. The virtual environment facilitates interactions by the attendee with the network security devices via real web interfaces of corresponding full-feature virtual network security appliances in connection with attempts by the attendee to complete the objectives. Upon completion of an objective, the leaderboard server's game state is updated. Based on the game state of a group of objectives a second group of problem-solving objectives is presented to the attendee.

column12: Interactive Exercise Machine with Social Engagement Support
column13: A social engagement system includes a first exercise machine having a display able to present videos, a three-dimensional camera system, and local processing system able to provide pose estimation based on data from the three-dimensional camera system. The system also includes a communication module for connection to a cloud processing system, with the cloud processing system supporting connection to a second exercise machine having a display able to present videos, a three-dimensional camera system, and local processing system able to provide pose estimation based on data from the three-dimensional camera system. Additionally, the connection allows transfer of data useful for social engagement.

column12: System and method for maintaining and configuring rotorcraft
column13: In an embodiment, a method includes: collecting usage and maintenance data for a rotorcraft at a computer of the rotorcraft; sending the usage and maintenance data to a fleet management server; generating individualized equipment data for the rotorcraft according to the usage and maintenance data at the fleet management server, the individualized equipment data including a lightweight digital representation of the rotorcraft and technical publications for the rotorcraft, the lightweight digital representation including mesh-based 3D visualizations of each component of the rotorcraft, the technical publications having views referencing the mesh-based 3D visualizations; sending the individualized equipment data to the computer of the rotorcraft; and persisting the individualized equipment data at the computer of the rotorcraft.

column12: Determine soft error resilience while verifying architectural compliance
column13: Verifying architectural compliance of a processor core using processor-sparing functions. A simulation of a model for a register-transfer level design of the processor core is performed. A first state of the model is dumped, when no error exists. An error is injected in the model. A second state of the model is dumped, after the injected error is detected in the simulation. Upon dumping the second state, the model is reset and initialized with the first state. State information of the second state is loaded in the reset and initialized model.

column12: INTRAORAL PROSTHESIS DIGITAL DESIGN METHOD BASED ON BIG DATA
column13: An intraoral prosthesis digital design method based on big data, relating to the field of oral restoration and restoration process, comprising: customizing a dental jaw feature data distance function, and obtaining dental jaw model feature data P2 closest to current dental jaw feature data P1 in distance; then using P2, dental jaw model entity data M2 of a sample where P2 is located, current dental jaw model data M1, and the current dental jaw feature data P1 as input of a non-rigid point matching algorithm to obtain a transformation function T21; and finally, applying the transformation function T21 to intraoral prosthesis feature data D2, and obtaining a design plan D1 by an adaptive surface fitting algorithm for reference by a prosthesis technician. The method greatly reduces excessive manual interactive design operations in the prior art, and quickly improves the design level, design efficiency, and design accuracy of operators.

column12: Information Technology Ecosystem Environment for Performing a Sustainability Operation
column13: A system and method for performing an information technology (IT) ecosystem monitoring and management operation. The IT ecosystem monitoring and management operation includes executing a sustainability application on a hardware processor of an IT component; an IT sustainability ecosystem console, the IT sustainability ecosystem console comprising an IT sustainability system, the IT sustainability system comprising a sustainability component, the sustainability component communicating with the sustainability application to perform a sustainability operation; and, communicating between the sustainability component and the sustainability application to perform a sustainability operation.

column12: Gamified lower limb exoskeleton rehabilitation equipment
column13: The utility model relates to the technical field of lower limb exoskeleton rehabilitation equipment, and discloses gamification lower limb exoskeleton rehabilitation equipment which comprises a hip supporting frame, a waistband is fixedly installed on the front surface of the hip supporting frame, and a waistband switch is fixedly installed on the front surface of the waistband. Thigh supporting frames are fixedly installed on the left side and the right side of the bottom of the hip supporting frame correspondingly, joint connecting rotary knobs are arranged above the opposite sides of the two thigh supporting frames correspondingly, thigh fixers are fixedly installed below the opposite sides of the two thigh supporting frames correspondingly, and shank supporting frames are arranged below the thigh supporting frames; according to the lower limb exoskeleton rehabilitation equipment, gamification rehabilitation training is achieved through the somatosensory technology, a built-in sensor senses actions of a patient and transmits game data to a patient terminal, rehabilitation of the patient is facilitated, training is not too boring, meanwhile, the equipment is portable, the use place is flexible, and the equipment is convenient to use. And therefore, the equipment is relatively high in practicability.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR DETERMINING AN AGENT PROFICIENCY WHEN ADDRESSING CONCURRENT CUSTOMER SESSIONS AND UTILIZATION THEREOF
column13: A computerized-method for determining an agent-proficiency when addressing concurrent customer sessions via one or more channel types and utilization thereof is provided herein. The computerized-method includes operating a Concurrent-Sessions-Handling-Agent-Proficiency (CSHAP) module. The CSHAP-module includes: (a) operating an interactions-module to retrieve one or more interactions and metadata thereof of the agent; (b) for each interaction, determining if the interaction has been handled with concurrent interactions; (c) for each determined interaction as handled with concurrent interactions, checking in the metadata if the interaction has one or more defocused-events; (d) calculating a CSHAP-score for the agent based on one or more attributes from the metadata of the interaction to provide an indication as to an ability of the agent to address concurrent customer sessions; (e) storing the calculated CSHAP-score in a data-store; and (f) sending the CSHAP-score to one or more applications, to take one or more follow-up actions based on the CSHAP-score.
column32: “Beyond calls: Modeling the connection center” to Liston et al, 1/3/2018 (Year: 2018)

column12: System and method of communication analysis
column13: A system and method are disclosed for a communication analytics system comprising a communication device and a system analyzer and the system analyzer is configured to continuously monitor electronic communications over the one or more communication devices and identify one or more communication activities associated with the electronic communications. The system analyzer is further configured to translate the one or more communication activities into communication data, store the communication data in a database and identify one or more correlations from the communication data.
column32: European Search Report for Application No. EP 16804225 dated Dec. 10, 2018. 1 Page.

column12: MEASUREMENT METHOD AND APPARATUS
column13: A method of controlling an imaging process uses a qualified optical proximity correction (OPC) model, including obtaining an OPC model that is configured to model the behavior of OPC modifications to a pre-OPC design in a process for forming a pattern on a substrate using a post-OPC design in a patterning process, using the patterning process in a manufacturing environment, collecting process control data in substrates patterned using the patterning process in the manufacturing environment, storing the collected process control data in a database, analyzing, by a hardware computer system, the stored, collected process control data to verify that the OPC model is correcting pattern features within a selected threshold, and for pattern features falling outside the selected threshold, determining a modification to the imaging process to correct imaging errors.

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR AN AGNOSTIC SYSTEM FUNCTIONAL STATUS DETERMINATION AND AUTOMATIC MANAGEMENT OF FAILURES
column13: The non-limiting technology described herein is a failure managing framework for complex systems that determines and restores functionality of failing systems and sub-systems using a function-based intervention approach having ontological content such as provided in a System State Graph directed graph. An integration framework allows integration of multiple intervention definition paradigms and selects the best for the current scenario; modifies procedures according to current context by encapsulating operator's tacit knowledge; provides an additional safety net during application of intervention and allows both autonomous operations and assistance to a human operator in the loop.

column12: Visual impairment experience learning system using robot dogs
column13: The present invention relates to a visual impairment experiential learning system using a robot dog (10). For a condition of a visually impaired person, a participant (30) wears an eye patch (blindfold) (31) and a body measuring device, a role of a blind assistance dog is replaced by a robot dog (10), and a role of a harness is replaced by guide equipment (32). In addition, a road environment experienced by the visually impaired from outdoors to a destination is replaced by a driving road for the visually impaired (flatland (21), uneven road (25), curved road (23), up and down stairs (24), and traffic light crosswalk (22)). When experiencing visual impairment using a participant self-measuring device (40), body data (blood pressure, pulse rate, stress index) of the participant (30) is measured, and based on a psychological state and body reaction at the time of the experience, the participant can understand a state of the body of a visually impaired person through the body data (blood pressure, pulse rate, stress index). By realizing the same environment experienced by the visually impaired until arriving at the destination, the visually impaired participant (30) can directly experience difficulties and pains experienced by the visually impaired.

column12: AUTOMATED PRODUCTION OF DEVICES FOR TREATING BONES
column13: FIELD: medicine.SUBSTANCE: method for making an implant for treating bone comprises a first step in which there are initial 3D data of a bone or portion of a bone of a specific patient to be treated, wherein the area to be treated, is located inside the bone or bone portion, the second step of including 3D data of the control patient, which was selected in accordance with predetermined criteria, wherein 3D data of the control patient included correspond to the bone or bone portion with the portion to be treated, and include 3D data of various specific patients by formatting an average value and/or using a statistical model, and a third and recovery step for supplementing or completing 3D data, combined with data obtained at the first stage and the second stage, to restore the area to be treated. Further, the implant workpiece, designed with the help of standard average values, stored in a database and is tied to a statistical model using design points and automatically placed in a previously reconstructed section to be treated, and where the implant-oriented bone-facing surface is subsequently adapted.EFFECT: technical result of the declared invention consists in improvement of adaptation of the device for bone treatment to specific patients.10 cl, 4 dwg
column14: KARL LEIBINGER MEDIZINTECHNIK GMBH & CO KG

column12: Charging device for non-linear elevator internet-of-things terminal standby battery
column13: The utility model belongs to the technical field of charging and discharging technologies of batteries, and particularly relates to a charging device of a non-linear elevator Internet of Things terminal standby battery, which comprises a terminal, an IC (integrated circuit), a PMOS (P-channel metal oxide semiconductor), an external power supply and a three-connection series battery, and is characterized in that the terminal comprises a shell and a display screen which is arranged on the front side wall of the shell and is used for displaying; the IC, the PMOS, the external power supply and the three-connection series battery are arranged in an inner cavity of the terminal, the IC is electrically connected with the PMOS and the external power supply through a voltage detection chip, and the IC is electrically connected with the external power supply through a discharging circuit. According to the utility model, aiming at the damage of large-current discharging and large-current charging to the battery in the power failure of the elevator Internet of Things, the service life of the battery is greatly prolonged by the circuit in the practical field use design, the product requirement on a charging power supply is reduced, the product cost is reduced, and the product quality is improved.
column14: SHANGHAI BAYIN ELECTRONIC TECH CO LTD

column12: INTEGRATED SYSTEM AND METHOD OF ANALYZING VEHICLE OPERATING PARAMETERS
column13: The subject of the invention is an integrated system and method of analyzing vehicle operating parameters. The sensing device includes a 3-axis overload sensor and is also equipped with an internal flash memory and a real-time clock module RTC. The electronic system of the sensing device is placed in a sealed ABS casing, detachably and rigidly mounted in the vehicle, preferably on the chassis beam. vehicle.

column12: Systems and methods for determining properties of composite materials for predicting behaviour of structures
column13: Engineered structures include materials in certain arrangement and proportions to make a composite that provides desired properties to a structure. The mechanical and physical properties of the materials are measured through expensive and time consuming mechanical testing, and structural design is carried out using these properties thus warranting more time and cost spent on physical testing. Embodiments of the present disclosure provide multi-scale modeling and simulation techniques (MSMST) for design of composite materials with desired macro-scale properties wherein the (lower) MSMST are interconnected and each can pass on corresponding desired outputs to higher length-scales, which in turn evaluate macro-scale physical and mechanical properties/either to scale up the structure simulation, or to fine tune computational materials parameters thereby predicting behaviour of the structure based on determined properties of composite materials of the structure.

column12: APPARATUS FOR MEASURING HUMAN PSYCHOPHYSICAL PERFORMANCE
column13: An apparatus for measuring human psychophysical performance, designed in a form of a board (1), controller (2) and moveable elements (7) with a display and press button (8), characterized in that it consists the board (1) where in one of the corners is located a controller (2) with press buttons (3) and a display (4), in the corners of the board (1) on extensions there are cameras 5 to analyse the movements of the participant, in the base of the board (1) built are aerial sensors (6) working in the RFID technology, on the board there is arranged a puzzle (7) consisting a display with a press button (8), on the button with the display 8 presented is a part of the puzzle or displayed is a photography with the response that is activated by pressing the button with the display (8), the board 1 on the rear wall consists an attached camera (9) to track the facial expressions. The puzzle (7) are moveable on the board (1) above the sensors (6). The puzzle (7) consists the receiver of the RFID system which sends the ID identification number in the wireless to the aerials (6).
column15: DOBROWOLSKA MALGORZATA;;GZIK MAREK;;WODARSKI PIOTR;;JEDRASIAK KAROL;;NAWRAT ALEKSANDER;;SZABO STANISLAV;;KALAVSKY PETER

column12: Built in configuration memory test
column13: Examples herein describe a self-test process where an integrated circuit includes a test controller responsible for testing a plurality of frames in the memory of an integrated circuit. The test controller can receive a test pattern which the controller duplicates and stores in each of the plurality of frames. However, frames may be non-uniform meaning the frames have varying sizes. As such, some of the frames may only store parts of the test pattern rather than all of it. In any case, the test controller reads out the stored data and generates a checksum which can then be compared to a baseline checksum generated from simulating the integrated circuit using design code to determine whether there is a manufacturing defect in the frames.

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR IDENTIFYING AND UTILIZING EFFECTIVENESS OF AN AGENT HANDLING ELEVATED CHANNELS DURING AN INTERACTION IN AN OMNICHANNEL SESSION HANDLING ENVIRONMENT
column13: A computerized-method for identifying and utilizing effectiveness of an agent elevating channels during an interaction, in an Omnichannel-Session-Handling environment, is provided herein. The computerized-method may operate, during a duty-cycle, an Elevated Interaction Efficacy (EIE) module for each agent in a data-storage of agents. The EIE-module may include: (a) operating an interaction-module to retrieve one or more interactions of the agent; (b) filtering out from the retrieved interactions, one or more elevated interactions, based on one or more attributes from metadata of the retrieved interactions; (c) calculating an Elevated Interaction Handling (EIH) score for the agent based on one or more attributes from the metadata of the one or more elevated interactions; (d) storing the calculated EIH score in the data-storage of agents; and (e) sending the EIH score to one or more applications, to take one or more follow-up actions based on the EIH score and a calculated EIH threshold.
column15: KHANVILKAR KUNAL;;PATANKAR MEHUL;;VYAS RAHUL;;DHAWAN SALIL;;CHAUHAN SOURAV

column12: Automatic teller machine game-based authentication functionality
column13: In an example, a method for implementing gamification in user authentication operations for a customer financial transaction device such as an automatic teller machine (ATM) or kiosk may be provided to improve security and enable enhanced electronic display and user interface features. In one example, the electronic operations for implementing gamification may include associated actions in a user interface authentication screen with defined gamification functions, receiving and evaluating input in the user interface authentication screen, and enabling or performing certain authentication actions based on an expected gamification action. In further examples, the gamification may be implemented based on themes for the user interface that match entertainment themes, individual games, or customizations to graphical and text content established by the user.
column15: EIDAM KOURTNEY;;GARNER IV ANDREW J;;DUKE MICHAEL THOMAS

column12: Depth design drawing generation method and system based on pixel-level image fusion
column13: The invention discloses a depth design drawing generation method and system based on pixel-level image fusion, and aims to solve the problems that pixel-level design of an image cannot be met and the 3D effect of the image cannot be displayed when a 3D effect drawing is designed in the prior art. According to the technical scheme, the method comprises the steps that an SVG file with vector elements is obtained; selecting a certain single element in the SVG file, performing rasterization processing on the SVG file through a specified resolution to obtain rasterized coordinate points, and then drawing pixel points on the rasterized coordinate points to generate bitmap data; intercepting and capturing bitmap data after rasterization, then performing binarization on the bitmap data through a set threshold value to generate a binarized image, and then performing distance transformation on the binarized image to obtain an edge distance from each pixel point to a line; and according to the edge distance from the pixel point to the line and the profile form, the carving depth is calculated, and a depth design drawing is generated.
column14: SHENZHEN CBPM & XINDA BANKING TECH CO LTD
column15: ZHOU ZONGCHENG;;WANG XI;;XIE WENJI;;MI SHIMIN;;WANG JUN

column12: Real-time detection device for abnormal signals in vehicle internal network based on programmable logic device and control method of the same
column13: Disclosed are a real-time detection device for an abnormal signal of an in-vehicle network based on a reconfigurable device, and a control method thereof. According to the present invention, the real-time detection device of the present invention which is a system for detecting a packet of an in-vehicle network in real time, and providing a notification message, can respond to various protocols in accordance with a situation by applying a reconfigurable device (programmable logic device), can implement a device capable of detecting an abnormal signal at high speed, can be provided as a tool for monitoring an internal network abnormal signal caused by an external attack in real time during a vehicle operation, and can be used as a tool for monitoring a signal caused by an internal system error in real time during a vehicle operation. In addition, the real-time detection device of the present invention can be mounted on a central gateway of a vehicle to function as a real-time abnormal signal detection filter of transmitted and received messages between internal networks of ECUs, can include a self-test function through an in-vehicle network abnormal signal input by loading an attack test case on a transmission message buffer, in addition to an original detection function, is applied with an optimal machine learning or deep learning algorithm in accordance with a vehicle model or a communication interface using design flexibility of a reconfigurable device, and allows reconfiguration of various communication interfaces and controllers between ECUs to apply an abnormal signal detection system even to LIN, Flex-Ray and a new communication protocol to be applied in the future, in addition to a CAN bus.

column12: Method, system and equipment for twin gamification health management based on personal health and computer readable storage medium
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of health management, in particular to a twin gamification health management method, system and device based on personal health and a computer readable storage medium, and the method comprises the steps: calling a twin object model, and matching model parameters; obtaining human health data, and updating model parameters; based on the updated model parameters, changes in the twin object are displayed. The method has the effects of improving self-health management and improving management fun.
column14: SHENZHEN AOJI MEDICAL TECH CO LTD

column12: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR REDIRECTING INBOUND-VOICE-INTERACTIONS TO DIGITAL CHANNELS IN A CONTACT CENTER
column13: A computerized-method for redirecting inbound-voice-interactions to digital channels in a contact center, is provided herein. The computerized-method includes: (i) operating a digital-qualifier module to determine a digital-medium-transition-quotient, of an inbound-voice-interaction of a customer in an inbound-queue. The digital-medium-transition-quotient is an indication of a level of suitability of a digital-communication-channel to resolve a customer issue; (ii) operating an interaction-redirection module to determine a digital-communication-channel for redirection of the inbound-voice-interaction, based on customer-preference and the determined digital-medium-transition-quotient; and (iii) forwarding the inbound-voice-interaction and the determined digital-communication-channel to an Automatic Call Distribution (ACD) system to be carried-out by an agent via the determined digital-communication-channel when the determined digital-medium-transition-quotient is above a preconfigured threshold.

column12: A SHOWER CONTROL DEVICE, SYSTEM AND METHOD
column13: A shower system configured to (i) during a first phase of a shower, provide water at a temperature according to user preference; (ii) convert from the first phase of the shower to a second phase of the shower in response to a predetermined level of usage of the shower during the first phase; and (iii) during the second phase of the shower, perform a reduction in the temperature of water supplied from the shower over a period of at least 10 seconds. A shower unit, a method of operating a shower system, methods for collecting and analysing usage data and using the analysis, a system configured to collect and analyse usage data and use the analysis, a shower control device, a method of operating a shower control device, a shower system, and a method of operating a shower system.

column12: ACTIVE CHAIR ACTIVITY TRACKING SYSTEM
column13: A user's motion while seated on an active chair is monitored and the user's metabolic expenditures stemming from the motion are determined. Information associated with or derived from the measured motion and/or determined metabolic expenditures maybe be displayed. Motion sensors and gyroscopes are configured to detect the motion of the active chair associated with active sitting while the user is sitting. Data from these sensors is used to determine sitting activity of the user. In addition, representations of the movement of the active chair can be displayed on a screen in real time, allowing for the gamification of sitting as a way to encouraging users to move more, or to move in prespecified ways so as to learn new movement patterns and new skills.

column12: Multi-specialty integrated design simulation system for complex electronic equipment
column13: The invention provides a multi-specialty integrated design simulation system for complex electronic equipment. The system comprises a simulation portal module, a telecommunication virtual prototype module, a structure virtual prototype module, a process virtual prototype module and a simulation data management module, system-level design simulation, subsystem-level design simulation and module-level design simulation are adopted; hierarchical design and simulation of telecommunication, structure and process are carried out; the design and simulation of each level work cooperatively, assembly planning of a three-dimensional model is established, simulation, data management, data release and digital field support of the three-dimensional model are integrated with one another, and whole-process transmission and application of three-dimensional model information from design, process to manufacturing and interaction with system-level design, subsystem-level design and module-level design are realized.

column12: Gamification learning environment creation method and system based on adversarial neural network
column13: The invention provides a gamification learning environment creation method and system based on an adversarial neural network. Behavior action data of users at different age stages is used as a data sample basis; the behavior action characteristics of the user at the same age stage and the matching difference state between the current learning interaction virtual space of the user and the behavioraction characteristics are analyzed; and finally, a certain part of area of the learning interaction virtual space is adjusted according to the matching difference state so as to obtain a learning environment adaptive to the user, so that personalized and game interesting adjustment of the learning environment is facilitated, and the efficiency and reliability of learning environment adjustment are improved.
column14: SHANGHAI SONGSHU CLASSROOM ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TECH CO LTD

column12: SYSTEM FOR MONITORING THE OPERATIONAL STATUS OF AN AIRCRAFT CREW, AND ASSOCIATED METHOD
column13: A system for monitoring the operational status of an aircraft crew comprises a unit for determining at least one pilot state based on first monitoring data of a high design assurance level and second monitoring data of a lower design assurance level. The determination unit comprises a first evaluation module capable of obtaining a high-level pilot state from the first data, regardless of the second data; a second evaluation module capable of determining a low-level pilot state, from at least the second data; and a consolidation module for determining a consolidated pilot state. The consolidated pilot state is obtained as a function of the high-level pilot state and the low-level pilot state.

column12: OPTIMIZATION OF EXPENSIVE COST FUNCTIONS SUBJECT TO COMPLEX MULTIDIMENSIONAL CONSTRAINTS
column13: A method is used to design nuclear reactors using design variables and metric variables. A user specifies ranges for the design variables and target values for the metric variables. A set of design parameter samples are selected. For each sample, the method runs three processes, which compute metric variables to thermal-hydraulics, neutronics, and stress. The method applies a cost function to each sample to compute an aggregate residual of the metric variables compared to the target values. The method trains a machine learning model using the samples and the computed aggregate residuals. The method shrinks the range for each design variable according to correlation between the respective design variable and estimated residuals using the machine learning model. These steps are repeated until a sample having a smallest residual is unchanged for multiple iterations. The method then uses the final machine learning model to assess relative importance of each design variable.
