column12: Prefabricated wallboard leveling design structure and leveling method
column13: The invention discloses a prefabricated wallboard leveling design structure, and belongs to the technical field of building leveling. The prefabricated wallboard leveling design structure comprises a wall body, a keel, an adjusting piece, a hanging plate and a wallboard, wherein the wall body is provided with a plurality of connecting grooves, the hanging plate is provided with a clamping groove, one end of the adjusting piece penetrates through the keel and is connected in the connecting groove, the other opposite end of the adjusting piece is clamped in the clamping groove, A fixing hole is formed in the hanging plate, the leveling detection piece is connected in the fixing hole, the leveling detection piece comprises a first connecting body, a second connecting body, a vertical rope and a detection body, a contact block, a spring, a pressure sensor, a display screen and a buzzer are arranged in an inner cavity of the detection body, and the wall plate is connected to the hanging plate. The adjusting piece is arranged between the wall body and the hanging plate, the leveling detection piece is arranged on the hanging plate, and the hanging plate is leveled according to the gravity perpendicularity principle, so that the overall smoothness of wallboard installation is improved, and the appearance effect and stability of wallboard installation are improved.

column12: Pattern inspection apparatus and pattern inspection method
column13: According to one aspect of the present invention, a pattern inspection apparatus includes: a profile extraction circuit configured to extract each of a plurality of predetermined dimensional profiles for a plurality of pixels with a value of a differential intensity greater than or equal to a threshold value in the image; a wavelet transform circuit configured to perform, on each of the plurality of predetermined dimensional profiles, a wavelet transform while changing a scale variable of a mother wavelet function to a predetermined value; and a contour position extraction circuit configured to extract, for the each of the plurality of predetermined dimensional profiles, a maximum peak position as a contour position of the figure pattern from peak positions of a plurality of transformed profiles of after the wavelet transform in which the scale variable is set.

column12: Solar unmanned aerial vehicle overall parameter design method based on flight performance
column13: The invention provides a solar unmanned aerial vehicle overall parameter design method based on flight performance, and the method comprises the steps: determining overall parameters of a solar unmanned aerial vehicle, and determining initial values of the overall parameters according to flight task information; performing flight performance simulation analysis according to the flight mission information, the initial value of the overall parameter, the time step length and the climbing rate to obtain an initial value of a flight performance parameter; and judging whether the initial value of the flight performance parameter meets the overall performance design requirement, if so, taking the initial value as a final optimization result, and if not, optimizing and adjusting the overall parameter until the optimized value of the flight performance parameter meeting the overall performance design requirement and the corresponding optimized value of the overall parameter are obtained. And taking the optimization value as a final optimization result of the overall parameters. According to the technical scheme, the technical problem that the overall parameter design cannot be guided due to the fact that the flight performance is difficult to calculate at the initial development stage of the solar unmanned aerial vehicle in the prior art is solved.

column12: Transmission substation and transmission method based on distributed strain monitoring system
column13: The invention discloses a transmission substation based on a distributed strain monitoring system. The transmission substation comprises an MCU circuit, a power supply, an interface circuit, a networkport, a GSM module, a 485 module, a can bus module, a zigbee module and an RS232 serial port. Wherein the power supply adopts a multi-level design, the first layer is a switching power supply which supports wide voltage input, and the second layer is a linear voltage stabilizer power supply which supplies power to the MCU circuit, the zigbee module, the GSM module and the internet access respectively. the invention provides the transmission substation and a transmission method based on the distributed strain monitoring system. The invention is suitable for a data centralized control center ofa coaxial cable strain monitoring system, adopts various different communication modes with a server and a lower computer, can transmit various data of a coaxial cable, is high in precision, small inerror and strong in environmental adaptability, and can carry out remote real-time online monitoring and long-term monitoring.

column12: TLM device of GPU rasterization module based on SysML view and operation method
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of computer hardware modeling, in particular to a TLM device of a GPU rasterization module based on a SysML view and an operation method. The device comprises a PRUBlock module, a PRU_CORE Block module and a PRU SC_CTHREAD module, wherein the PRUBlock module is provided with a pin-port, and the input-port comprises a geu2sgu_pdu_bus port; and the TLM device is further provided with a plurality of socket channels used for communication. The method comprises the following steps: 1) initializing variables, judging a rasterization FIFO state, if the rasterization FIFO state is empty, setting BUSY to be 0, and if the rasterization FIFO state is not empty, setting BUSY to be 1; 2) obtaining primitive data, and when the BUSY is 1, obtaining complete primitive data from the rasterization FIFO; and 3) judging the area of the primitives. The invention provides the TLM device of the GPU rasterization module based on the SysML view and the operation method, which can avoid tedious circuit signal design, quickly evaluate the architecture of a large-scale hardware system, and are suitable for early system-level design and development of circuits.

column12: High-precision automatic pin inserting device based on servo motor
column13: The invention discloses a high-precision automatic pin inserting device based on a servo motor, and the device comprises a main control module which is used for receiving a signal from the outside of the main control module in real time, and transmitting a control instruction to the outside of the main control module; a motor module which comprises a plurality of groups of manipulators driven by servo motors and is in signal connection with the main control module, wherein the manipulators perform corresponding operation on the preformed holes of the elements according to the control instructions; a feeding module which is in signal connection with the motor module and is used for conveying the Pin to the manipulator; a carrying module which is in signal connection with the main control module, and carries the element to a designated position for Pin pin insertion. Based on the use design of the plurality of servo motors, the manipulator can realize three-axis movement, so that the manipulator can adapt to positions of preformed holes of different elements for mounting in the process of mounting and inserting the Pin, and the automation degree and the pin inserting precision are obviously improved.

column12: Method of controlling game difficulties through quantification of the relationship between game elements and game contents playing time
column13: The present invention relates to a method of controlling game difficulty through quantification of the relationship between a game element and game content consumption time and, more specifically, to a method of controlling game difficulty through quantification of the relationship between a game element and game content consumption time, which allows a game user to quantify and identify the influence of property values of corresponding game elements on game playing time based on data on time for interacting with the corresponding game elements in game content in accordance with changes of the individual property values of the game elements appearing in the game to set the game elements through a preset combination in a proper property value range suitable for a game level in accordance with the corresponding level to support the convenience of a level design of the game elements and increase immersion in the game through proper game difficulty control.

column12: Automatic digital data feedback and utilization in aircraft part lifecycle
column13: An aircraft lifecycle in which digital data for an aircraft part is automatically collected, retained, and utilized to individualize aircraft inspection and maintenance is described. Several types of data, including non-destructive evaluation and measurement data and structural health monitoring data, are used in a feedback loop having various phases which may automatically receive data in digital format from other phases. In this manner the part being designed, fabricated, tested, and maintained for the aircraft is optimized and processes involved in the lifecycle of the part is made more efficient.

column12: Structure and performance design method and device of low-temperature/normal-temperature liquid-liquid centrifugal nozzle
column13: The invention provides a structure and performance design method and device for a low-temperature/normal-temperature liquid-liquid centrifugal nozzle, and the method comprises the steps: determining the structure and performance parameters of an outer nozzle according to the parameters of low-temperature fluid entering the outer nozzle and the technical parameters of the outer nozzle; according to the parameters of the low-temperature fluid entering the secondary injection hole and the technical parameters of the secondary injection hole, the structural parameters of the secondary injection hole are determined; and determining the structure and performance parameters of the inner nozzle according to the parameters of the normal-temperature fluid entering the inner nozzle and the technical parameters of the inner nozzle. The method and the device are suitable for determining structure parameters and performance parameters of the centrifugal nozzle under the condition that normal-temperature liquid and low-temperature liquid are mixed, and determination can be carried out based on an empirical formula obtained through a long-term test and fluid dynamics according to liquid physical property data, performance index parameters and interface structure parameters; by the adoption of the method, the problems of repeated modeling and repeated simulation in the design process are avoided, and a rapid design method is provided for centrifugal nozzle design.
column15: XU TING;;GUO CANLIN;;YIN JINRUI;;WEI XUEFENG;;LIN YUAN;;MIAO QINGYUAN;;XIANG LU

column12: Infrared jamming bomb kinematics inversion modeling method and system
column13: The invention provides an infrared jamming bomb kinematics inversion modeling method and system. The infrared jamming bomb kinematics inversion modeling method comprises the steps that S1, information of a jamming bomb is extracted from outfield actual measurement data; s2, constructing a dynamic parameter kinematics model of the jamming bomb according to the jamming bomb information; s3, dynamic parameter estimation of the dynamic parameter kinematic model of the jamming bomb is carried out, and the change rule of the combustion speed and the air resistance coefficient of the jamming bomb along with the flight state of the jamming bomb is obtained. According to the method, tracking and motion feature extraction are carried out on the infrared jamming bomb mainly based on an external field actual measurement video, a kinematic model is constructed, and then high-precision dynamic parameter estimation is completed. The method is mainly applied to digital or semi-physical simulation tests in the weapon field, reproduction of a jamming bomb launching scene is achieved so as to effectively verify and analyze the anti-interference capability of a guided missile, and support is provided for optimization of anti-interference performance design of an infrared air defense missile.
column15: WANG BINGQIAN;;LI FAN;;SHE SHAOBO;;ZHANG XIAOWEI;;SHEN TAO;;YANG YANG

column12: Composite stress common mode aerospace electromechanical product reliability digital verification method
column13: The invention provides a composite stress common-mode aerospace electromechanical product reliability digital verification method. The technical method effectively solves the problem that reliability weak links of product design are difficult to discover early and more links are difficult to discover. The composite stress profile of the product is effectively enveloped, and verification conditions difficult to simulate on the ground can be reproduced; product function performance and reliability analysis and evaluation requirements are met, and a typical failure mode of the product is effectively covered; the disadvantages of few product subsamples and relative lack of ground and actual operation data are effectively made up, and the reliability analysis and verification precision can be improved; scheme optimization is carried out in the design stage, and the current situation that traditional reliability work is lagged relative to performance design work is solved; the method can effectively save the time and cost of reliability test verification, greatly improves the timeliness of reliability verification, and has great economic benefits. The method provides important reference for reliability verification of aerospace mechanical and electrical products, and can be popularized and applied to other mechanical and electrical product fields.
column15: ZHU XINGGAO;;CHEN FENGXI;;LUAN JIAHUI;;DAI YONGDE;;ZHANG ZHONGWEI;;LIU XIAOYU

column12: Wafer-level synaptic electron array device based on two-dimensional semiconductor and preparation method of wafer-level synaptic electron array device
column13: The invention discloses a wafer-level synaptic electron array device based on a two-dimensional semiconductor and a preparation method of the wafer-level synaptic electron array device. The wafer-level synaptic electron array device includes the following elements: a wafer-level bottom electrode, a two-dimensional semiconductor material as a functional layer, and a top electrode on the top of the material. The wafer-level design method is suitable for preparing a wafer-level array device, and the compatible size range of the wafer-level array device is from 2 inches to 32 inches. Each unit of the wafer-level synapse electronic array device is provided with two output ports, the bottom output port is marked as an electrode I, and the top output port is marked as an electrode II. And reliable ohmic contact is formed between the functional layer and the electrode. The preparation method allows the preparation of a wafer-level synaptic electron array device of a two-dimensional semiconductor, and the functional layer can comprise a multi-layer stack, thereby forming a heterostructure or 1S1R, 1D1R structures, even a 3D multilayer output structure in the longitudinal direction. The top electrode can be designed to be a transparent electrode to realize photoelectric simultaneous modulation so as to realize a photoelectric synapse bionic function. In addition, the wafer-level synaptic electronic array device of the two-dimensional semiconductor has flexible substrate compatibility, and a package is arranged outside the wafer-level synaptic electronic array device. The invention also supports the three-dimensional device design of the array, and provides a new design thought for the wafer-level synaptic electron array device of a two-dimensional semiconductor.

column12: DEVICE AND METHOD FOR CONTROLLING AND/OR CONFIGURING A CONSTRUCTION MACHINE
column13: The invention relates to a device for controlling and/or configuring construction machines, whose electronic control device can be reconfigured and/or extended by installing a program packet, comprising a central server for providing and/or downloading different program packets, wherein the central server has access to an internal machine data database in which different machine data sets are stored, wherein the central server is designed as an open server platform with different interfaces to different external host servers, wherein a communications module activates an interface to an external machine data database and/or to an external host server according to a construction machine and/or program packet request and according to the machine data sets in the internal machine data database, and wherein the external machine data database that is separate from the central server is designed to provide a program packet of an external host server according to an authorization of the external host server.

column12: ARTICLE INSPECTION DEVICE
column13: To provide an article inspection device which, when inspecting the shape state of an inspection object using design data, enables inspection to be performed for each region formed in the inspection object.SOLUTION: When a commodity package is designed by CAD, etc., design data is preliminarily generated with lines having attributes differentiated by a contour line or gridline, a cut-in line, a half-cut line, an emboss line, a pattern, and a hue. Then an image is acquired from the commodity package, while at the same time an inspection program or a parameter is changed for each type of line having the same attribute among lines of design data having been used when the commodity package is designed, and comparison is made with image data from the image acquired by image acquisition means 2, whereby inspection is conducted.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 6

column12: Methods and systems for compressing shape data for electronic designs
column13: Methods for compressing shape data for a set of electronic designs include inputting a set of shape data, where the shape data comprises mask designs. A convolutional autoencoder encodes the set of shape data, where the encoding compresses the set of shape data to produce a set of encoded shape data. The convolutional autoencoder is tuned for increased accuracy of the set of encoded shape data based on design rules for the set of shape data. The convolutional autoencoder comprises a set of parameters comprising weights, and the convolutional autoencoder has been trained to determine what information to keep based on the weights.

column12: Flexible DC converter valve power module capacitor voltage equalizing method
column13: The invention discloses a flexible DC converter valve power module capacitor voltage equalizing method, which comprises the steps of generating an input sequence and a cut-off sequence according to aninput and cut-off sequence of a power module and a capacitor voltage state of the power module; and then selecting the input sequence according to bridge arm current, the input and cut-off requirement and the voltage-sharing effect requirement and a set exchange rule, cutting off corresponding modules in the sequence to perform input and cut-off state exchange, and generating a new input sequenceand a new cut-off sequence. According to the invention, the capacitor voltage of the module is not needed, the real-time performance of the capacitor voltage of the module is not required, the moduleonly needs to upload the over-limit information under the condition that the capacitor voltage exceeds the limit, and the data volume uploaded by the module is greatly reduced, so that the performance design requirement of the system can be met without a relatively high communication data rate; and the feasibility is provided for the valve control system to adopt an intensive scheme, the implementation difficulty and technical requirements of the intensive scheme of the valve control system are reduced, and the total manufacturing cost of the valve control system is reduced.

column12: Image inspection device and image processing method
column13: Provided is an image inspection device which can prevent a degradation in the accuracy of an estimation value of a probability distribution caused by position displacement between design data and a captured image in image processing in which a model that estimates a pixel value probability distribution of a captured image is trained by using design data and the captured image of a sample. The image inspection device inspects a captured image by using design data and the capture image of a sample, the device being characterized by comprising: a training processing unit which trains a probability distribution estimation model that estimates, from the design data, a pixel value probability distribution of the captured image; and an inspection processing unit which inspects a captured image for inspection by using the probability distribution estimation model created in the training processing unit, design data for inspection, and the captured image for inspection, wherein the training processing unit includes: a probability distribution estimation unit which estimates, from sample design data for training, a pixel value probability distribution of a sample captured image for training; a position displacement amount estimation unit which estimates a position displacement amount between a probability distribution during training estimated by the probability distribution estimation unit, and the captured image for training; a position displacement reflection unit which reflects, to the probability distribution during training, the estimation position displacement amount estimated by the position displacement amount estimation unit; and a model update unit which evaluates the probability distribution estimation model of the probability distribution estimation unit by using the captured image for training and the probability distribution during training to which the position displacement calculated by the position displacement reflection unit has been reflected, and updates parameters of the probability distribution estimation model according to the evaluation values.

column12: SCAN OPTIMIZATION USING DATA SELECTION ACROSS WORDLINE OF A MEMORY ARRAY
column13: A system includes a memory array with sub-blocks, each sub-block having groups of memory cells. A processing device, operatively coupled with the memory array, is to perform operations including performing, after a wordline is programmed through the sub-blocks, scanning of the wordline. The scanning includes selecting, to sample first data of the wordline, a first group of the groups of memory cells of a first sub-block of the sub-blocks; selecting, to sample second data of the wordline, a second group of the groups of memory cells of a second sub-block of the sub-blocks; concurrently reading the first data from the first group and the second data from the second group of the groups of memory cells; and performing an error check of the wordline using the first data and the second data.

column12: INSPECTION APPARATUS AND INSPECTION METHOD
column13: Provided is an inspection apparatus including: an irradiation source irradiating a first pattern formed on an inspection target object with an electron beam; a detection circuit acquiring a first inspection image generated from the first pattern by irradiation; a filter circuit performing smoothing using a local region having a first size in a direction parallel to a first outline included in the first inspection image and a second size smaller than the first size in a direction perpendicular to the first outline and acquiring a second inspection image including a second outline generated by the smoothing; and a comparison circuit comparing the second inspection image with a predetermined reference image.

column12: Educational Delivery Platform
column13: A computer implemented system and method for a gamified social media educational platform for interacting with a participant via the Internet using four distinct educational modules. An introduction module for focus and commitment. A setting goals module for long term, flexible direction in life. A success module for harnessing a participant's passion. A tools of the trade module for mental, emotional, physical tools. And an activity sessions module for selecting physical exercises for the participant.

column12: Graded and staged drought limit water level design and control method for reservoir
column13: The invention provides a graded and staged drought limit water level design and control method for a reservoir, and belongs to the technical field of drought control scheduling. Firstly, a water supply guarantee target is analyzed and water supply requirements are designed. Secondly, reservoir runoff processes of different early warning levels are designed y examining the reliability, consistency and representativeness of long-series hydrological data; and the seasonal characteristics of factors such as reservoir runoff, reservoir operation water level and water supply demand are comprehensively considered, and drought early warning and staging are carried out on hydrological years. Thirdly, according to the designed water demand process and the water supply guarantee priority, a graded and staging drought limit water level water supply rule is determined, and graded and staging drought limit water levels are preliminarily determined; and finally, based on long-series runoff process simulation, grading and staging drought limit water level rationality analysis and adjustment are carried out. According to the rationality analysis method based on long-series simulation and the reservoir drought limit water level feedback correction method, the requirements for the system water supply guarantee rate and the damage depth in engineering application can be comprehensively considered, calculation is rapid and convenient, and the method is suitable for engineering application and popularization.

column12: PROXIMITY SENSOR AND PROXIMITY SENSING METHOD USING DESIGN VISION SENSOR
column13: 이벤트 기반 비전 센서를 이용한 근접 센서 및 근접 센싱 방법이 개시된다. 근접 센서는 근접 센서가 촬영한 이미지에서 집속성 광원으로부터 출력된 출력광이 오브젝트에 의해 반사된 포인트를 식별하는 포인트 식별부; 및 상기 포인트의 위치를 기초로 오브젝트와 근접 센서 간의 거리를 결정하는 거리 결정부를 포함할 수 있다.

column12: Device for testing hitting power of breaking hammer
column13: The invention relates to breaking hammer testing equipment, and provides a device for testing the hitting power of a breaking hammer to solve the problems that an existing breaking hammer hitting power testing system is complex and large in testing result error. The device comprises a breaking hammer, a fixing base fixed to a breaking hammer shell and a force measuring sensor, and the force measuring sensor comprises a stress component and a resistance strain gauge arranged on the stress component; and the stress component is in a U shape, side plates on the two sides of the stress component are fixedly connected with the fixing base at a U-shaped opening, the side plates on the two sides are located on the two sides of a drill rod of the breaking hammer and are parallel to the moving direction of the drill rod, and an end transverse plate of the stress component is right opposite to the head of the drill rod and is within the moving stroke range of the head of the drill rod. The breaking hammer hitting power testing device is simple in structure, the action during breaking hammer testing is the same as the action during breaking, the hitting force load spectrum during breaking hammer operation can be obtained, and reliable data input is provided for excavator structural part fatigue design and breaking hammer performance design under the breaking hammer working condition.

column12: Platform special for dynamic test of multi-rotorcraft
column13: The invention provides a platform special for dynamic testing of a multi-rotor aircraft, and relates to the field of unmanned aerial vehicle dynamic testing, and the platform comprises a fixed frame, a floating frame, an aircraft bearing assembly, an X-direction tension sensor, a Y-direction tension sensor and a Z-direction tension sensor. The floating frame is arranged in the fixed frame; a plurality of longitudinal supporting rods are arranged between the floating frame and the fixed frame. The aircraft bearing assembly comprises a carrying platform, a center fixing base, a Z-direction rotating shaft and an XY bidirectional rotating installation base assembly at least comprising an X-direction rotating shaft and a Y-direction rotating shaft. The X-direction rotating shaft is sleeved with an X-direction angle sensor, the Y-direction rotating shaft is sleeved with a Y-direction angle sensor, and the Z-direction rotating shaft is sleeved with a Z-direction angle sensor. According to the invention, the traction force data of the multi-rotor aircraft flying in the X, Y and Z directions can be conveniently obtained, the deflection angles of the multi-rotor aircraft flying in the X, Y and Z directions can be obtained, the test results are diversified, and the requirements of the performance design of the unmanned aerial vehicle can be well met.

column12: Device for testing hitting power of breaking hammer
column13: The utility model relates to breaking hammer testing equipment, and aims to solve the problems that a hitting power testing system of an existing breaking hammer is complex and testing result errors are large. The breaking hammer hitting power testing device comprises a breaking hammer, a fixing base fixed to a breaking hammer shell and a force measuring sensor, and the force measuring sensor comprises a stress component and a resistance strain gauge arranged on the stress component; the stress component is in a U shape, side plates on the two sides of the stress component are fixedly connected with the fixing base at a U-shaped opening, the side plates on the two sides are located on the two sides of a drill rod of the breaking hammer and are parallel to the moving direction of the drill rod, and an end transverse plate of the stress component is right opposite to the head of the drill rod and is within the moving stroke range of the head of the drill rod. column12: Method and system for three-dimensional forward design of municipal highway bridge
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of BIM design, in particular to a municipal highway bridge three-dimensional forward design method and system. Comprising the following three stages: bridge conceptual design: creating a bridge conceptual object based on a three-dimensional road route, a road surface, a geophysical prospecting three-dimensional model and bridge initial data to complete the bridge conceptual design; bridge overall design: on the basis of the bridge conceptual design result, on the basis of the resource library template, contour-level, feature-level, component-level and component-level design resource design and reuse can be realized to complete bridge overall three-dimensional design; according to detailed design of the bridge, design information borne by the bridge is inherited on the basis of overall design of the bridge, granularity mapping splitting of the components is achieved, the split components can be finely designed according to design requirements, and therefore detailed three-dimensional design of the bridge is completed. By adopting the method, the bridge design efficiency can be effectively improved.

column12: Two-level LED security light with motion sensor
column13: An LED security light includes a light emitting unit, at least one sensing unit, a loading and power control unit and a power supply unit configured with a first power source and a second power source, wherein a power level detector and a power switching circuitry are installed to select and connect at least one of the first power source and the second power source to the light emitting unit. The light emitting unit is activated at dusk and is deactivated at dawn. When the first power source is used, the LED security light generates a first level illumination. When the second power source is used, the LED security light generates a second level illumination. The first power source is a solar power while the second power source is a backup battery.

column12: Arbitrary-order matrix inversion hardware acceleration system based on cholesky decomposition, which adopts loop iteration mode
column13: The invention provides an arbitrary-order matrix inversion hardware acceleration system based on cholesky decomposition in a loop iteration mode. The arbitrary-order matrix inversion hardware acceleration system comprises a DSP core, an external DDR memory, an AXI interface, a main controller, a double DMA controller, an SRAM memory, a PE operation array and a matrix inversion operation module. The matrix inversion module comprises three sub-operation modules, namely a cholesky decomposition sub-operation module, a triangular matrix inversion sub-operation module and a triangular matrix multiplication sub-operation module, and the three sub-operation modules use the same data storage mode; a loop iteration method is adopted to replace traditional multiply-accumulate calculation to solve aresult of cholesky decomposition and an inverse matrix of a triangular matrix, so that the addressing complexity during data reading and writing is reduced; a novel matrix multiplication algorithm suitable for a triangular matrix is adopted, so that the calculation time of matrix multiplication is shortened; the system supports inversion operation of a complex matrix with any order from 4 to 256 orders, has the characteristics of low hardware complexity and high storage resource utilization rate, and realizes a high-order high-performance design target.

column12: Method for designing and manufacturing digital removable denture metal support
column13: The invention provides a method for designing and manufacturing a digital removable denture metal support. The method comprises the following steps: acquiring target oral cavity data, designing a support for the target oral cavity data based on design software, and generating support data; importing support data based on programming software, performing preprocessing, and converting the preprocessed support data from three-dimensional data to two-dimensional fault data based on software hierarchical operation; performing layer-by-layer sintering processing on the two-dimensional fault data tomanufacture a first digital movable denture metal support; and based on a process treatment mechanism, performing process treatment on the first digital movable denture metal support, and performing dry electrolytic polishing on the first digital movable denture metal support subjected to process treatment to obtain a second digital movable denture metal support. Digital design is carried out by using design software, and errors in the aspect of materials in the manufacturing process are effectively avoided, and the adaptation degree of the removable denture support is improved by using the dry electrolytic polishing machine.

column12: Li-ion battery capacity and voltage prediction using quantum simulations
column13: Methods, systems, and computer programs for selecting electrode materials for a lithium battery are presented. In one embodiment, a method includes an operation for developing models for structural and energy analysis of battery stability, safety, cycling and performance, where the models are developed based on a selection of elements and compositions for the electrode materials. Properties of at least on cell performance parameter are estimated, and a cell discharge rate behavior is calculated. Another operation in the method is provided for selecting an electrode material composition based on the estimated properties and the cell discharge rate behavior. The method operations are performed by a computer system that includes a processor.

column12: MULTITURN ANGLE MEASURING DEVICE

Tire plunger and tire bead unseating test machine capable of reducing the operational steps and time involved in bead unseating testing and enhancing the operational efficiency and accuracy of test results
column13: A tire plunger and bead unseating test machine comprising a base, a first sliding seat, a second sliding seat, and an actuating arm. This tire test machine is capable of concurrently conducting tests on the tire's tread and bead to obtain test data for tire bead requirements and bead unseating capability, effectively reduces the time and labor costs associated with tire replacement and transfer, consequently enhances the efficiency of tire testing, and also helps to improve the accuracy of test data integration and analysis. Through the dual-use design, this machine not only lowers the cost of machine acquisition but also addresses concerns related to the space required for machine placement. It substantiates practical utility and convenience.

column12: Covert Gates To Protect Gate-Level Semiconductors
column13: Integrated circuit (IC) camouflaging has emerged as a promising solution for protecting semiconductor intellectual property (IP) against reverse engineering. The cell camouflaging covert gate leverages doping and dummy contacts to create camouflaged cells that are indistinguishable from regular standard cells under modern imaging techniques. A comprehensive security analysis of the covert gate shows that it achieves high resiliency against SAT and test-based attacks at very low overheads. Models are derived to characterize the covert cells, and metrics are developed to incorporate them into a gate-level design. Simulation results of overheads and attacks are presented on benchmark circuits.
column15: FORTE DOMENIC J;;SHAKYA BICKY;;SHEN HAOTING;;TEHRANIPOOR MARK M

column12: IMAGE DISPLAY DEVICE
column13: An object is to provide an image display device capable of correcting a position in a simple manner even when a deviation occurs in position alignment in accordance with movement of a user. The image display device 100 includes a correction processing unit 102 that corrects a deviation when the deviation occurs between image data G and a steel frame T in a field of vision of a user U that occurs in accordance with movement of the user. This correction processing unit 102 acquires a coordinates correction position S that becomes a reference position used for a correction process from the steel frame T1 or the like that is a partial member using design data stored by a storage unit 103 and a self-position of the user U with respect to the steel frame T. The correction processing unit 102 performs correction by performing position alignment of the image data G on the basis of the one coordinates correction position S.

column12: Method and device for adapting product to wall hole and electronic equipment
column13: The invention provides a method and device for adapting a product to a wall hole and electronic equipment, and relates to the technical field of data processing. Setting wall hole category data; wherein the wall hole category data comprises a first preset formula; judging whether a feature code is set in a sleeve line included in a target product installed in the wall hole or not; wherein the attribute information of the target product comprises an initial size; and if yes, correcting the initial size of the target product based on the initial wall hole size and the first preset formula to obtain a target size of the target product so as to enable the product to be matched with the wall hole when a casing line is added in actual production. According to the invention, the matching effect of a door and window product designed by using design software and the size of a wall hole can be effectively improved.

column12: Method and device for converting hypergraph structure into RTL-level HDL file
column13: The invention discloses a method and device for converting a hypergraph structure into an RTL-level HDL file. The method comprises the steps of obtaining a total syntax tree structure, a hypergraph structure file and a hypergraph segmentation result of an original RTL-level HDL file; constructing an initial top layer module based on the total syntax tree structure; based on the hypergraph structure file and the hypergraph segmentation result, deleting the first target module in the sub syntax tree structure, restoring the second target module into a sequential logic module, and restoring the third target module into a combinational logic module; based on the hypergraph structure file, saving the module interconnection relation by a Map data structure; based on the module interconnection relationship, adjusting internal and external ports of the corresponding FPGA, so that the sub syntax tree structure can be instantiated into a complete FPGA; and generating a converted RTL-level HDL file based on the adjusted sub syntax tree structures and the initial top layer module. The hypergraph segmentation result can be efficiently and accurately restored to the RTL-level design of the HDL.
column14: SHANGHAI GUOWEI S2C TECH CO LTD

column12: Fuzzy testing a software system
column13: The disclosure is directed to a method, system and a computer readable medium of fuzzy testing a software system, using a grey-box fuzzy testing framework that optimizes the vulnerability exposure process while addressing security testing challenges. The grey-box fuzzy testing framework, unlike white-box testing, provides a focused and efficient assessment of a software system without analyzing each line of code. The disclosed embodiments provide a robust security mechanism that accumulates information about the system without increasing testing complexity, enabling fast and efficient security testing. The disclosed embodiments use security vulnerability metrics designed to identify vulnerable components in the software systems and ensures thorough testing of these components by assigning weights. A mutation engine may perform small data type mutations at the input's high-level design. The grey-box approach addresses three testing challenges: the system's complexity and size by avoiding intensive code analysis, outsourcing by limiting the knowledge about the system, and input and output fluctuation by creating a massive number of inputs.

column12: Method for judging gathering and transportation pipeline material selection
column13: The invention discloses a method for judging gathering and transportation pipeline material selection, belongs to the field of thick oil development gathering and transportation, and aims to solve the problem of selection of gathering and transportation pipeline materials, simplify the material selection process and guarantee gathering and transportation safety. The technical route comprises the following steps: carrying out 7-influence-factor 3-level design on a weight-loss-method corrosion experiment by utilizing an orthogonal experiment method; establishing an average corrosion rate prediction model of different materials based on a weight loss method corrosion experiment; calculating the corrosion performance index of the material by using the corrosion performance index equation; performing a tensile property test through a tensile testing machine, and calculating the tensile property index of the corroded material; and optimizing by using the corrosion performance index and the tensile performance index to determine the optimal material. The method has the beneficial effects that seven factors are considered, the application range is wide, and the generalizability is high; theoretical calculation is combined with experimental data, and the accuracy is high.

column12: INTEGRATED RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PLATFORM FOR TERAHERTZ FOCAL PLANE IMAGING SYSTEM
column13: Disclosed is an integrated research and development platform for a terahertz focal plane imaging system. The platform includes a terahertz integrated collaborative design simulation sub-platform, a terahertz chip testing and modeling sub-platform, a terahertz beam testing and characterization sub-platform, a terahertz system testing and principle verification sub-platform, and an ultra-large-scale array signal real-time acquisition and processing sub-platform. The platform is applicable to the whole-process research and development, from a chip, a module and a front end to a principle sample machine, of a terahertz focal plane imaging system, and can improve research and development effects for the terahertz focal plane imaging system.

column12: Multi-mode radio-frequency signal rapid detection and high-speed acquisition and processing integrated equipment
column13: The invention provides multi-mode radio-frequency signal rapid detection and high-speed acquisition and processing integrated equipment. High-performance real-time detection and processing of pulse signals are realized through an intermediate-frequency signal sampling and digital signal processing technology; the logic part of the digital signal processing FPGA is mainly responsible for processing various types of signals, and the processor part of the FPGA runs an on-chip embedded system and is mainly responsible for various external interfaces of equipment; under the condition that performance requirements are met, high integration of a detection and acquisition position of a product is achieved through chip-level design, the structure is more advanced and flexible, expansibility is higher, continuity and accuracy of signal detection and reception can be remarkably improved through a phase frequency discrimination technology, a multi-symbol joint detection technology (MSD) and a bit synchronization technology, and the signal detection and reception efficiency is improved. The STFT-based pulse signal detection technology can improve the detection and discovery probability of weak signals, and the RS error correction decoding and Walsh transformation technology can realize high-quality packaging of data and the like.

column12: Lifeguard Positioning System And Method
column13: A method of training a lifeguard to properly view an area of a swimming pool or body of water and recognize a swimmer/bather in distress. The method includes: positioning submersible devices or other objects on a bottom of the swimming pool or body of water according to an established grid or pattern; observing the submersible devices to make observations; analyzing the observations to evaluate the ability to see the submersible devices under varying environmental and density conditions. The observation trains the lifeguard to recognize the swimmer/bather in distress in the swimming pool or body of water to minimize the risk of the swimmer/bather drowning.

column12: Backside Metallization for FPGA Resources
column13: A programmable logic device may include a first layer formed using backside metallization on a back plane of the programmable logic device and a second fabric routing circuitry to route second data within the programmable fabric. The first layer may include first fabric routing circuitry to route first data within a programmable fabric of the programmable logic device, and clock routing circuitry to route clock signals within the programmable fabric.

column12: Vehicle wind resistance coefficient determination method and device and medium
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of data processing, and discloses a vehicle wind resistance coefficient determination method and device and a medium, and the method comprises the steps: placing a vehicle three-dimensional model of a target vehicle in a cubic bounding box, carrying out the recursive octree segmentation of the cubic bounding box, and carrying out the calculation of a wind resistance coefficient in each sub-cube corresponding to a preset depth, determining the sub-cubes containing the geometric surfaces as target non-empty voxels, determining the sub-cubes not containing the geometric surfaces as target empty voxels, obtaining corresponding voxel features, discretizing the outer shape of the target vehicle according to an octree structure, and simplifying the discrete complex curved surface through a normal vector to obtain a target non-empty voxel. According to the method, details of the original three-dimensional model can be reserved, then the wind resistance coefficient prediction model is used for carrying out feature extraction on the octree-form outer model, the wind resistance coefficient is rapidly determined, the problems that vehicle wind resistance performance design and verification are long in period and high in cost can be solved, and the accuracy of the wind resistance coefficient is guaranteed.

column12: TECHNOLOGY FILE PROCESS RULE VALIDATION
column13: A method and system disclosed for validating technology file design rules, including obtaining a technology file with design rules that are to be validated. An input test case library is obtained with design rule cell-views for each corresponding design rules. The design rule cell-view includes a first set of failed test cases. An output data is generated by using Design Rule Driven (DRD) tool, to test the design rules based on the design rule cell-views. The test output data provides a second set of failed test cases associated with the corresponding design rule. A validation result is determined for each of the plurality of design rules based on the first set of failed test cases and the second set of failed test cases associated with the design rule. Finally, a validation report is generated including the validation result for each design rules.
column15: JOSHI PHANIRAJ;;KANG PILWON;;LEE KYUWON;;JO YOUNGROG;;IQBAL ZAMEER;;INGOLE NITIN KISHORKUMAR

column12: Bluetooth intelligent cloud sound box based on control data interaction improvement
column13: The utility model discloses a Bluetooth intelligent cloud sound box based on control data interaction improvement, which comprises a sound box, an outer ring is arranged on the outer side wall of the sound box, a mounting seat is arranged at the top end of the sound box, an adjusting key is arranged at the top end of the mounting seat, a camera is arranged on the outer side wall of the outer ring, and a Bluetooth module is arranged on the outer side wall of the camera. An infrared sensor is installed on the outer side wall of the outer ring. By arranging the camera and the infrared sensor, a human face can be aligned to the area of the infrared sensor during use, the infrared sensor can detect a human body and reflect the human body to the internal processing module, the camera is controlled to start irradiation work, and after the human face image is detected and captured, the human face image is transmitted to the processing module and is in accordance with a portrait input in the early stage of a cloud end for comparison; and finally, the sound box can be controlled to be opened, intelligent control and unlocking of the sound box can be completed by controlling the camera and the quasi-infrared sensor, data network interaction control can be carried out, and the use design is more intelligent.
column14: SHENZHEN KAIWU MUCHUANG TECH CO LTD

column12: METHOD FOR ESTIMATING SERIES CAPACITANCE OF TRANSFORMER
column13: To estimate a series capacitance without using design data such as a structure and dimension of a winding.SOLUTION: The method comprises: measuring the transfer function of a transformer winding by inductive inter-winding measurement; constructing a circuit model 1 in which the winding is divided into a plurality of pieces in an axial direction; and when reproducing a transfer function measured by the inductive inter-wiring measurement in the circuit model 1 using a ground capacitance Cg,H of a divided part of the windings as a parameter, estimating the total sum of the ground capacitances of the division parts at the time of reproduction as the series capacitance of the transformer windings.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2
column14: CENTRAL RES INST ELECTRIC POWER IND

column12: DEFECT INSPECTION DEVICE
column13: To provide a defect inspection device that is robust against noise and manufacturing errors without using design data during inspection.SOLUTION: A defect inspection device includes: a feature amount calculation unit that calculates a feature amount based on a captured image of a sample; an image information reduction unit that generates a latent variable by reducing an amount of information of the feature amount; a statistics estimation unit that estimates image statistics that a normal image can take based on the latent variable; and a defect detection unit that detects defects in an inspection image based on the image statistics and the inspection image of the sample.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: METHOD AND COMPUTER-AIDED SYSTEM FOR DETECTING LIFE CYCLE INFORMATION ABOUT A SWITCHGEAR CABINET OF AN INDUSTRIAL INSTALLATION
column13: A method and a system for collecting and processing of life cycle information about a switch cabinet (1) of an industrial plant, with a documentation server (2) for linking data sheet information (A) of the built-in modules (9a-9c) installed in the switch cabinet (1) on the basis of the planned construction (4) with function information (B) about their use in the context of the switch cabinet equipment, in order to store this information in a central archive database (3) under an individual switch cabinet identification (8) in data records, wherein test and acceptance information (C) of the switch cabinet (1) is added to the data records of the central archive database (3) via the documentation server (2).

column12: TILE LAYOUT COST ESTIMATION SYSTEM IN PRECUT TILE
column13: To provide a system for cost-estimating precut tile layout, by setting working width of pantiles to 1/(integer) of a design unit dimension of a building, and by setting a horizontal projection dimension of a working length to an integer ratio with the design unit dimension of the building, and thereby patterning shapes of precut pantiles constructed to roof face ends and setting of tiles of every roof part.SOLUTION: The present invention provides a tile layout cost estimation system that includes means of: calculating tile setting code for every roof part by a computer, by using design dimension data for various roofs, roof shape data and tile product design dimension data for tile roofs having the patterned shape of precut pantiles constructed to roof face ends, by setting working width of pantiles to 1/(integer) of a design unit dimension of a building, and by setting a horizontal projection dimension of a working length to an integer ratio with the design unit dimension of the building; outputting tile layout drawings and tile setting code for every roof part; and preparing roof tile layout drawings.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: DESIGN SYSTEM AND DESIGN METHOD
column13: A design system (1) using the three-dimensional finite element method to assist in the design of a structure to be designed. The design system is characterized by comprising a calculation unit (4) for: using design data relating to the configuration of and the load on a structure to carry out three-dimensional analysis of the stress components that will act on the structure in response to earthquake input; calculating a history indicating the relationship between two or more stress components that will act on the structure; setting a design stress space so as to envelope an area including the history in a protruding shape; and using the design stress space to calculate a first design stress that will act on a cross section of the structure.

column12: BAYESIAN OPTIMIZATION FOR MATERIAL SYSTEM OPTIMIZATION
column13: A method of optimizing a process having a plurality of potential inputs, comprising selecting a first set of inputs from the plurality of potential inputs, providing the first set of inputs from the to a first optimization process, running an objective function on the first set of inputs to produce a value corresponding to the set of inputs, providing the value to a second optimization process, running an acquisition function in the second optimization process to select a new candidate set of inputs from the plurality of potential inputs, and providing the selected new candidate set of inputs to the first optimization process. In one embodiment, the inputs are a set of lattice kernels for constructing a structural object. A Bayesian optimization is used to select sub-sets of kernels from the set of inputs. The inputs are provided to a topology optimization for evaluation.

column12: Restoration effect prediction modeling method of organic polluted underground water in-situ chemical oxidation process
column13: The invention relates to a restoration effect prediction modeling method of an organic polluted underground water in-situ chemical oxidation process. The method specifically comprises the following steps: step 1, performing detailed investigation on the basis of a polluted site; 2, determining an in-situ chemical oxidation process of the polluted site, and determining a related parameter range; 3, using a Plackett-Burman test for determining main influence factors of the effect of the repairing technology; 4, analyzing the response of different independent parameters by using Design Expert software to obtain test combinations under different test conditions; and 5, carrying out a laboratory small-scale test based on the simulated sample, and the like. The method is simpler and more convenient, the requirement for mathematical knowledge of operators is low, data is used as a support, the statistics principle is used as a support, and the problems of model uncertainty and mathematical calculation difficulty caused by the underground complex environment are emphatically solved.

column12: TRACK SHAPE DATA ESTIMATION METHOD AND TRACK SHAPE DATA ESTIMATION SYSTEM
column13: To provide a track shape data estimation method and a track shape data estimation system capable of calculating track shape data of a designated section by actually traveling on a track in the section as a creation object of track shape data without using design values of the track shape.SOLUTION: A track shape data estimation method includes: a pendulum inclination angular velocity acquisition step of acquiring a pendulum inclination angular velocity for each truck; a pendulum inclination angular velocity difference calculation step of calculating a difference between pendulum inclination angular velocities of preceding and succeeding trucks; a correction value calculation step of calculating a correction value by multiplying the difference between the pendulum inclination angular velocities by a predetermined coefficient; a correction vehicle body yaw angular velocity calculation step of calculating a correction vehicle body yaw angular velocity by subtracting the correction value from the vehicle body yaw angular velocity; a track curvature equivalent value calculation step of calculating a track curvature equivalent value from the correction vehicle body yaw angular velocity and a traveling speed; and a cant equivalent value calculation step of calculating a cant equivalent value from the correction vehicle body yaw angular velocity, the traveling speed, and a truck frame lateral acceleration.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 4

column12: DYNAMIC LOADLINES FOR PROGRAMMABLE FABRIC DEVICES
column13: Systems or methods of the present disclosure may provide for determining a loadline for operation of a programmable logic fabric where the loadline is based at least in part on design configuration details for a design or a configuration rather for generic deployment of the programmable logic device. The loadline may be determined using software modeling for the design or configuration. Additionally or alternatively, the loadline may be determined using runtime testing and sensing of real-world parameters. This determination based on real-world parameters of a deployment of the configuration or design is based on a determination of a step load for the design or configuration.

column12: Construction project field leveling method
column13: The invention belongs to the technical field of mountainous area urbanization construction project leveling, and particularly relates to a construction project leveling method. According to the method, material collection, plot division, plot rough leveling, plot rough leveling data identification and arrangement, plot adjustment sequence determination, plot leveling adjustment mode determination, plot leveling adjustment according to the adjustment sequence, and project earthwork balance determination after each plot is adjusted. If the earthwork is balanced, summarizing the adjustment schemes and the non-adjustment schemes of all the land parcels to form a final land leveling scheme; when earthwork balance cannot be achieved after all the land parcels are adjusted, the minimum earthwork discarding is taken as the final scheme, the land leveling optimization design of the project is completed, the problems of land parcel and road connection, land parcel land leveling adjustment mode judgment, adjustment content, corresponding earthwork volume change and the like are indexed, indexes penetrate through the whole process of the land leveling design, and the land leveling optimization design efficiency is improved. The purposes of minimum project earthwork volume and most economic performance are achieved, and the problem of omission easily occurring during artificial subjective design is avoided.

column12: Function state and user behavior dynamic synchronization global closed-loop function verification method
column13: The invention provides a function state and user behavior dynamic synchronous linkage global closed-loop function automatic verification method. The method comprises the following steps: generating a functional capability (FC) based on a user demand and a product function, defining elements of a functional state model (FSM) according to the generated FC, determining a relationship among the elements of the FSM, and generating the FSM; the interaction behavior between the user and the system is simulated based on the dynamic synchronous interconnection between the FSM and the simulation platform. The invention provides an integrated framework integrating expert experience knowledge, dynamic synchronous verification and reverse optimization design, lays a foundation for subsequent system and component level design, and can be expanded to system and component level function safety verification so as to realize safety guarantee of the whole product life cycle.

column12: "WEAK" UNDRIVEN STATE MODELLING FOR POWER MANAGEMENT VERIFICATION
column13: A “weak” undriven state is defined as a signal state, distinguished from conventional unknown and high impedance states, and methods of representing this “weak” undriven state in circuit modelling and power aware digital/mixed-signal simulations for comprehensive and complete RTL-level design verification. The conventional unknown state refers to a circuit element that is powered but has an unknown value, a circuit element that is not powered, or a circuit element having an undriven, floating signal. The unknown state is modified, and the “weak” undriven state refers to a circuit element that is not powered and has an unknown value. The “weak” undriven state can have an electrically high impedance to known supply or ground when no other circuit element is active. The “weak” undriven state distinction is particularly useful to model and verify circuit designs known to be resilient to “weak” undriven states, using event driven logic circuit simulators.

column12: System on chip (SoC) builder
column13: Methods and example implementations described herein are generally directed to a System on Chip (SoC) design and verification system and method that constructs SoC from functional building blocks circuits while concurrently taking into account numerous chip level design aspects along with the generation of a simulation environment for design verification. An aspect of the present disclosure relates to a method for generating a System on Chip (SoC) from a floor plan having one or more integration descriptions. The method includes the steps of generating one or more connections between the integration descriptions of the floor plan based at least on a traffic specification, and conducting a design check process on the floor plan. If the design check process on the floor plan is indicative of passing the design check process, then the method generates the SoC according to the one or more connections generated between the integration descriptions.

column12: Verification method based on comprehensive simulation of interface circuit
column13: The invention provides a verification method based on comprehensive simulation of an interface circuit, and the method comprises the steps: carrying out the modeling of a control drive interface circuit based on parameters, and forming a whole control loop; performing simulation verification on the whole control loop; the interface circuit comprehensive simulation technology is adopted, modeling simulation is carried out on the control instruction circuit, the processing conversion circuit and the execution circuit, the verification period is shortened, the verification reliability and comprehensiveness are improved at the same time, and the method is successfully applied to multiple projects at present. Meanwhile, the system-level design evaluation problem of a finished product interface circuit can be solved by utilizing a verification method for comprehensive simulation of the interface circuit; by using the verification method of comprehensive simulation of the interface circuit, the iteration verification period of finished product circuit change is greatly shortened.

column12: Chip design method of optimizing circuit performance according to change in PVT operation conditions
column13: A method of designing a chip having an integrated circuit is provided. The method includes obtaining delta cell delays and delta net delays according to a process, voltage, and temperature (PVT) corner change with respect to a plurality of cells and a plurality of nets forming the integrated circuit; analyzing sensitivity with respect to a delay according to the PVT corner change of a plurality of paths in the integrated circuit, by using the delta cell delays and the delta net delays; determining N-number of sensitivity-critical paths among the plurality of paths based on a result of the analysis, wherein N is an integer greater than or equal to 0; and performing an engineering change order (ECO) based on a result of the determination.

column12: SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE
column13: A semiconductor device is provided. The semiconductor device includes a first-direction plurality of wirings extending in a first direction, and a second-direction plurality of wiring extending in a second direction intersecting the first direction. The first-direction plurality of wirings that extend in the first direction includes gate wirings spaced apart from each other in the second direction by a gate pitch, first wirings above the gate wirings spaced apart from each other in the second direction by a first pitch, second wirings above the first wirings spaced apart from each other in the second direction by a second pitch, and third wirings above the second wirings spaced apart from each other in the second direction by a third pitch. A ratio between the gate pitch and the second pitch is 6:5.

column12: CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT DEVICE
column13: To provide a ground improvement management system that can form a high-quality ground improvement body and that can centrally manage various types of information related to ground improvement construction.SOLUTION: A construction management device 10 that is used for ground improvement construction comprises: a three-dimensional model creation unit 311 that creates a three-dimensional model that corresponds to a ground improvement body formed in the ground using design information; a storage element creation unit 312 that divides a rod insertion direction for a three-dimensional model into multiple directions and creates a plurality of data storage elements 41 that have location information; a storage element import unit 313 that checks location information from the data storage elements 41 with location information of information for ground improvement construction, and links the data storage element 41 and the information for ground improvement construction for which their position information match; and a ground information determination unit 314 that obtains ground information at a formation position for the ground improvement body based on drilling information when inserting a rod into the ground to drill a hole. The storage element import unit 313 links design information and ground information with the data storage elements 41.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2

column12: Integrated circuits as a service
column13: Systems and methods are disclosed for automated generation of integrated circuit designs and associated data. These allow the design of processors and SoCs by a single, non-expert who understands high-level requirements; allow the en masse exploration of the design-space through the generation processors across the design-space via simulation, or emulation; allow the easy integration of IP cores from multiple third parties into an SoC; allow for delivery of a multi-tenant service for producing processors and SoCs that are customized while also being pre-verified and delivered with a complete set of developer tools, documentation and related outputs. Some embodiments, provide direct delivery, or delivery into a cloud hosting environment, of finished integrated circuits embodying the processors and SoCs.

column12: HEAT SINK LAYOUT DESIGNS FOR ADVANCED FINFET INTEGRATED CIRCUITS
column13: A layout of a semiconductor device stored on a non-transitory computer-readable medium includes a first transistor in an active device region, the first transistor comprising a first channel region a first source region and a first drain region. The layout further includes a second transistor in a guard ring region, the second transistor comprising a second channel region a second source region and a second drain region. The second channel region includes a semiconductor material having a higher thermal conductivity than a semiconductor material of the first channel region.

column12: Ultrasensitive micro RNA quantification
column13: The present invention relates to an ultrasensitive assay platform for the detection of nucleic acids such as microRNAs (miRNAs), which are important biomarker for diseases including cancer. The platform allows high throughput detection of multiple nucleic acid sequences miRNAs on the single-molecule level using fluorescence labeling, molecular barcoding, and flow based detection and multiparametric data analysis.

column12: SUBSTRATE INSPECTION DEVICE, SUBSTRATE INSPECTION METHOD, AND STORAGE MEDIUM
column13: A substrate inspection device for inspecting a substrate, includes: a setting part configured to define a group according to a basic state that is not dependent on a presence or absence of a defect in a substrate and set the defined group for each inspection target substrate; an inspection part configured to perform a defect inspection based on a captured image of the inspection target substrate and an inspection recipe corresponding to the defined group to which the inspection target substrate belongs and including a reference image; a recipe creation part configured to create the inspection recipe for each group; and a determination part configured to perform a determination as to whether a group-setting target substrate, for which the group is set by the setting part, belongs to the group defined by the setting part.

column12: Layout establishment method and system for radar infrared single-mode and dual-mode general semi-physical simulation system
column13: The invention provides a radar infrared single-mode and dual-mode general semi-physical simulation system layout establishment method and system, and the method comprises the following steps: S1, carrying out the overall establishment of a system, and determining the composition of the system; s2, establishing a space structure according to the system composition; s3, according to the established space structure, performing quiet zone characteristic analysis processing to obtain a space structure layout meeting the quiet zone characteristics; s4, according to the spatial structure layout meeting the quiet zone characteristics, infrared imaging analysis processing is carried out, and the spatial structure layout meeting the infrared imaging requirement is obtained. According to the method, the conflict between the electromagnetic performance and the infrared imaging performance of the radar in the same physical space is effectively solved, and the design repetition and the performance contradiction caused by only considering the single performance design are avoided.

column12: Microwave/infrared composite radome comprehensive performance design method
column13: The invention discloses a microwave/infrared composite radome comprehensive performance design method. The method comprises the following steps: establishing a geometric model of a radome; determiningthe dielectric property, the mechanical property and the optical property of the radome body material; determining the initial wall thickness of the radome, establishing an electrical performance simulation model of the radome microwave band, and optimizing an electrical performance simulation result; determining initial normal wall thickness distribution of the radome body; establishing a staticheat intensity simulation model of the radome microwave band and optimizing a static heat intensity simulation result; calculating the wave transmittance of the radome in the infrared band; comprehensively determining the normal wall thickness distribution of the radome body in the microwave irradiation area and the infrared transmission area; and determining the connection mode of the radome. According to the method, the working reliability of the radome in two wavebands is ensured, the design margin of the radome is improved, and the process is simple and comprehensive.

column12: SAMPLE OBSERVATION SYSTEM AND IMAGE PROCESSING METHOD
column13: To improve the throughput of sample observation by estimating a reference image from a defect image without using design data in a sample observation system.SOLUTION: A sample observation system includes a scanning electron microscope and a computer, and (1) acquires a plurality of images captured by the scanning electron microscope, (2) acquires a learning defect image including the defect portion and a learning reference image not including the defect portion from the plurality of images, (3) calculates an estimation processing parameter using the learning defect image and the learning reference image, (4) acquires an inspection defect image including the defect portion, and (5) estimates a pseudo reference image using the estimation processing parameter and the inspection defect image.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2

column12: Oyster phenotype evaluation method based on simulated intertidal zone environment
column13: The invention discloses an oyster phenotype evaluation method based on a simulated intertidal zone environment. The oyster phenotype evaluation method comprises the steps of sea area selection, tide level design, simulated intertidal zone environment system construction, phenotype evaluation and the like. According to the method, related factors of oyster biology and oceanography are combined, thecharacters of an intertidal zone high tide area, an intertidal zone medium tide area, an intertidal zone low tide area and a subtidal zone can be systematically evaluated under the same water qualityand substrate conditions according to the biological characteristics of oysters, the problem of character evaluation caused by long distance between each intertidal zone and large differences in sediment, food organisms, enemy species and other factors is avoided, and the method has the advantages that the stability is high, sampling is easy to operate, the maintenance cost is low, the number ofharmful organisms is small, and accurate evaluation of the oyster intertidal zone phenotype is achieved.

column12: Radiobiology multifunctional experiment box
column13: The utility model discloses a multifunctional experimental box for radioactive organisms. The device structurally comprises an experiment box, a bin door, an experiment bin, a control panel, a plug, an electricity storage box, an electric wire, a water mist storage bin, a constant-pressure bin, a push plate, a first push rod, a second push rod, a hinge, a handle, a water mist emission port, a constant-pressure bin connector, an electric heating lamp, a temperature sensor, a humidity sensor, a temperature and humidity display screen, a temperature adjusting button and a humidity adjusting button. The overall design of the device belongs to the principle level design, the device is not really realized in a real experiment, the device is mainly designed aiming at the temperature, namely the humidity regulation control principle, namely the operation mode method, the device is convenient to operate and easy and convenient to install and manufacture on the principle level, and the device also has an obvious effect on the temperature and humidity regulation mode. The device is suitable for experiment implementation of various biological research institutes.

column12: Structure Estimation System and Structure Estimation Program
column13: The present disclosure relates to a system and a non-transitory computer-readable medium for estimating the height of foreign matter, etc. adhering to a sample. In order to achieve the abovementioned purpose, proposed is a system, etc. in which data acquired by a charged particle beam device or features extracted from the data are input to a learning model, which is provided with, in an intermediate layer thereof, a parameter learned using teacher data having data acquired by the charged particle beam device or features extracted from the data as inputs and having the heights or depths of the structures of samples or of foreign matter on the samples as outputs, and height or depth information is output.
